member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDComponentLocation
member.summary: The ON_SubDComponentLocation enum is used when an ON_SubD component is referenced and it is important to distinguish between the component's location in the SubD control net and its location in the SubD limit surface.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDComponentLocation.Unset

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDComponentLocation.ControlNet
member.summary: The component's location in the SubD control net. Note well: This value is saved in 3dm archives and cannot be changed.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDComponentLocation.Surface
member.summary: The component's location in the SubD limit surface. Note well: This value is saved in 3dm archives and cannot be changed.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexTag
member.summary: ON_SubDVertexTag identifies the type of subdivision vertex. Different tags use different subdivision algorithms to determine where the subdivision point and limit point are located. There are toplological constraints that restrict which tags can be assigned.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexTag.Unset
member.summary: Not a valid vertex tag and the default value for ON_SubDVertex.m_vertex_tag. This encourages developers to thoughtfully initialize ON_SubDVertex.m_vertex_tag or use ON_SubD.UpdateAllTagsAndSectorCoefficients() to automatically set the m_vertex_tag values at an appropriate time.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexTag.Smooth
member.summary: Must be an interior vertex. All edges attached to a smooth vertex must be tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth and must have 2 faces.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexTag.Crease
member.summary: Can be an interior or a boundary vertex. Exactly two edges ending at a crease vertex must be tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease and may have 1 or 2 faces. All other edges ending at a crease must be tagged as tagON_SubD::EdgeTag::Smooth and have 2 faces. Below P = ON_SubDVertex.ControlNetPoint() and Ai = ON_SubDVertex.Edge(i)->OtherEndVertex()->ControlNetPoint(). A crease vertex subdivision point is (6*P + A1 + A2)/8. A crease vertex limit surface point is (4*P + A1 + A2)/6.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexTag.Corner
member.summary: Can be an interior, boundary, nonmanifold, or isolated vertex. The location of a corner vertex is fixed. The all subdivision points and the limit point are at the initial vertex location. The edges ending at a corner vertex can be smooth or crease edges. A corner vertex subdivision point is P where P = ON_SubDVertex.ControlNetPoint(). A corner vertex limit surface point is P where P = ON_SubDVertex.ControlNetPoint().

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexTag.Dart
member.summary: Must be an interior vertex. Every edge attached to a dart vertex must have 2 faces. Exactly one edge attached to a dart vertex must be tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease and every other attached edge must be tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::smooth.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeTag
member.summary: ON_SubDEdgeTag identifies the type of subdivision edge. Different tags use different subdivision algorithms to calculate the subdivision point.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeTag.Unset
member.summary: Not a valid edge tag and the default value for ON_SubDEdge.m_edge_tag. This encourages developers to thoughtfully initialize ON_SubDEdge.m_edge_tag. or use ON_SubD.UpdateAllTagsAndSectorCoefficients() to automatically set the m_edge_tag values at an appropriate time.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeTag.Smooth
member.summary: At least one the edge's vertices must be tagged as ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth. The edge must have exactly two faces. The edge's subdivision point is (A1 + A2 + S(f1) + S(f2))/4, where Ai = ON_SubDEdge.Vertex(i)->ControlNetPoint() and S(fi) = ON_SubDEdge.Face(i)->SubdivisionPoint().

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeTag.Crease
member.summary: Both of the edge's vertices must be tagged as ON_SubDVertexTag::Dart, ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease, or ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner. (The vertex tags can be different.) The edge can have any number of faces. The edge's subdivision point is (A1+A2)/2 where Ai = ON_SubDEdge.Vertex(i)->ControlNetPoint().

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeTag.SmoothX
member.summary: This tag appears only on level 0 edges that have exactly two neighboring faces and both of the edge's vertices are tagged as ON_SubDVertexTag::Dart, ON_SubDVertexTag::Crease, or ON_SubDVertexTag::Corner. The level 1 subdivision point for a level 0 edge tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX is the standard smooth edge subdivision point. When subdivided, the new subdivision vertex will be tagged as ON_SubDVertexTag::Smooth and the subdivided edges will be tagged as ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth. The tag ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX can only appear on a level 0 edge. This tag exists because the ON_SubD subdivision algorithm requires any edge with both end vertices tagged as not smooth must be subdivided at its midpoint. Sector iterators treat "SmoothX" edges as smooth. Both edge m_sector_coefficient[] values must be set so the smooth subdivided edges will be valid.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType
member.summary: ON_SubDEdgeType describes a subdivision edge. ON_SubDEdgeType is typically used when generating text descriptions or filtering edges during selection processes. Do not confuse ON_SubDEdgeType and ON_SubDEdgeTag. The unique types are single bits and suitable for use in bitwise logic.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.Unset
member.summary: Type is unset or the edge is not valid.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.Wire
member.summary: The edge has zero faces and the tag is ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.Boundary
member.summary: The edge has one face and the tag is ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.InteriorSmooth
member.summary: The edge has two faces, the tag is ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth or ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX, and the edge sharpness is zero. Note that ON_SubEdge::IsSmoothNotSharp() returns true if and only if ON_SubEdge::EdgeType() is InteriorSmooth.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.InteriorSharp
member.summary: The edge has two faces, the tag is ON_SubDEdgeTag::Smooth or ON_SubDEdgeTag::SmoothX, and the edge sharpness is nonzero. Note that ON_SubEdge::IsSharp() returns true if and only if ON_SubEdge::EdgeType() is InteriorSharp.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.InteriorCrease
member.summary: The edge has two faces and the tag is ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.Nonmanifold
member.summary: The edge has three or more faces and the tag is ON_SubDEdgeTag::Crease.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.Invalid
member.summary: The edge has an invalid combination of face count, tag, and sharpness properties.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.InteriorMask
member.summary: A mask for all interior edge types. Interior edges have 2 faces.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEdgeType.ValidTypesMask
member.summary: A mask for all valid edge types.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDHashType
member.summary: ON_SubDHashType used used to specify what type of SubD information is hashed (topology or geometry).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDHashType.Unset
member.summary: Unset indicates the hash type still needs to be selected. It is not a valid type for calculating a hash.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDHashType.Topology
member.summary: The Topology hash includes component ids, and all topological relationships between vertices, edges, and faces. If two SubDs have the same topology hash, then the the have identical labeled control net topology.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDHashType.TopologyAndEdgeCreases
member.summary: The TopologyAndEdgeCreases includes all information in a Topology hash. The TopologyAndEdgeCreases adds edge crease/smooth attributes. Many contexts, including face packing and exploding, take edge creases into account when partitioning a SubD into regions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDHashType.Geometry
member.summary: A geometry hash includes all information in a TopologyAndEdgeCreases hash. The Geometry hash adds vertex tags, vertex control net points, and nonzero subdivision displacements on vertices, edges, and faces. If two SubDs have the same geometry hash, then they have identical surface geometry.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions
member.summary: Options used for converting a SubD to a Brep

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption
member.summary: ON_SubDToBrepParameters::Vertex identifies the options for post processing extraorindary vertices.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption.None
member.summary: The NURBS patches are used as is. At extraordinary vertices, the brep vertex may not be G1. Typically the deviation bewtween the brep and SubD surface is smallest with this option.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption.LocalG1
member.summary: At extraordinary vertices, the NURBS patches are modified so they are G1 at the extraordinary vertex. Typically the deviation bewtween the brep and SubD surface is larger than None and smaller than LocalG1x and LocalG2.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption.LocalG2
member.summary: At extraordinary vertices, the NURBS patches are modified so they are G2 at the extraordinary vertex. Typically the deviation bewtween the brep and SubD surface is larger than LocalG1 and LocalG1x.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption.LocalG1x
member.summary: At extraordinary vertices, the NURBS patches are modified so they are G1 at the extraordinary vertex and tend to be closer to G1 along edges near the extraordinary vertex. Typically the deviation bewtween the brep and SubD surface is larger than LocalG1 and smaller than LocalG2.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption.LocalG1xx
member.summary: At extraordinary vertices, the NURBS patches are modified so they are G1 at the extraordinary vertex and G1 along edges near the extraordinary vertex. The patches will have one double knot near the extraordinary vertex.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Create default options

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcessOption)
member.summary: Create options from the given packFaces and vertexProcess values.
member.param: Sets the extraordinary vertex process option.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.Default
member.summary: Default SubDToBrepOptions settings. Currently selects the same options as DefaultUnpacked: Locally-G1 smoothing of extraordinary vertices, unpacked faces.
member.remarks: These are the settings used by ON_SubD::BrepForm()

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.DefaultPacked
member.summary: Default ON_SubDToBrepParameters settings for creating a packed brep. Locally-G1 smoothing of extraordinary vertices, packed faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.DefaultUnpacked
member.summary: Default ON_SubDToBrepParameters settings for creating an unpacked brep. Locally-G1 smoothing of extraordinary vertices, unpacked faces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.PackFaces
member.summary: Get or sets the pack faces option.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDToBrepOptions.ExtraordinaryVertexProcess
member.summary: Get or sets the extraordinary vertex process option.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFromSurfaceMethods
member.summary: ON_SubDFromSurfaceParameters::Method are ways to create a SubD from a surface.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFromSurfaceMethods.Unset
member.summary: Used to indicate the method is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFromSurfaceMethods.SubDFriendlyFit
member.summary: The surface is approximated with a SubD friendly NURBS surface and the SubD is created to match the subd friendly nurbs surface. If the input surface is a subd friendly NURBS surface, the subd and surface have the same geometry.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFromSurfaceMethods.FromNurbsControlNet
member.summary: The surface is converted to a NURBS surface and then a subd with one face per NURBS bispan is created by using an appropriate subset of the NURBS surface control net. If the input surface is a subd friendly NURBS surface, the subd and surface have the same geometry.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEndCapStyle
member.summary: ON_SubDEndCapStyle enumerates the type of end caps functions like ON_SubD::CreateCylinder will create. Use ON_SubDEndCapStyleFromUnsigned(integer value) to convert integer values to an ON_SubDEndCapStyle. Use ON_SubDEndCapStyleToString(end_cap_style) to convert ON_SubDEndCapStyle values to string descriptions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEndCapStyle.Unset
member.summary: Used to indicate the end cap style is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEndCapStyle.None
member.summary: Ends are not capped.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEndCapStyle.Triangles
member.summary: Ends are capped with triangles.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEndCapStyle.Quads
member.summary: When the end has an even number of edges, is will be capped with quads. Otherwise it will be capped with triangles.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDEndCapStyle.Ngon
member.summary: Ends are capped with a n-gon. This is a poor choice when there are a large number of edges in the end boundary.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexFacetType
member.summary: Summarizes the number of edges in faces in the whole object.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexFacetType.Unset
member.summary: Not a valid vertex face type.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexFacetType.Tri
member.summary: All faces are triangular.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexFacetType.Quad
member.summary: All faces are quads.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexFacetType.Ngon
member.summary: Edge count of faces is constant and > 4.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDVertexFacetType.Mixed
member.summary: Edge count of faces is not constant.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType
member.summary: SubD::ChainType specifies what edge and vertex tag tests are used when creating edge chains.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType.Unset
member.summary: Unset.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType.MixedTag
member.summary: All types of edges and vertices can be in the chain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType.EqualEdgeTag
member.summary: Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease property.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType.EqualEdgeAndVertexTag
member.summary: Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease edge tag and interior vertices have the corresponding smooth/crease vertex tag.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType.EqualEdgeTagAndOrdinary
member.summary: Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease property and every edge has the same number of faces. If the edges have 1 face, then interior vertices have valence = 3. If the edges have 2 faces, then interior vertices have valence = 4.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDChainType.EqualEdgeAndVertexTagAndOrdinary
member.summary: Every edge in an edge chain has the same smooth/crease edge tag, every edge has the same number of faces, and interior vertices have the corresponding smooth/crease vertex tag. If the edges have 1 face, then interior vertices have valence = 3. If the edges have 2 faces, then interior vertices have valence = 4.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType
member.summary: ON_SubD::SubDFriendlyKnotType identifies the types of subd friendly NURBS knot vectors. SubD friendly NURBS curves and surfacaes are always cubic and nonrational. Any time there is a multiple knot, the 2nd derivative is zero at the corresponding parameter. SubD friendly NURBS curves are either periodic or have zero 2nd derivative at the ends.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType.Unset
member.summary: Not a valid type. Used to indicate the type has not been set and to encourage developers to explicitly specify a type.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType.UnclampedUniform
member.summary: NURBS knot vector is an unclamped uniform cubic knot vector. Every knot interval has the same length. Every knot has multiplicity 1.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType.ClampedUniform
member.summary: NURBS knot vector is a clamped uniform cubic knot vector. Every interior knot interval has the same length. End knots have multiplicity 3 and interior knots have multiplicity 1.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType.ClampedPiecewiseUniform
member.summary: NURBS knot vector is a clamped piecewise uniform cubic knot vector. All nonzero knot intervals have the same length. End knots have multiplicity 3 and interior knots have multiplicity 1 or 3. Interior knots with multiplicity 3 correspond to interior SubD creases.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDFriendlyKnotType.Unfriendly
member.summary: NURBS knot vector is not subd friendly.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDAutomaticMeshToSubDContext
member.summary: ON_SubD::AutomaticMeshToSubDContext identifies a context where meshes can automatically be converted to subds.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDAutomaticMeshToSubDContext.Unset
member.summary: Indicates the context has not been initialized.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDAutomaticMeshToSubDContext.Rhino5BoxModeTSpline
member.summary: A mesh in a Rhino 5 3dm file that is a representation of a box mode T-spline. By default, these meshes are automatically converted to subds.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDAutomaticMeshToSubDContext.FBXMeshWithDivisionLevels
member.summary: A mesh in an FBX file that has nonzero values for either preview division levels or render division levels. Some FBX files created by Maya save subdivision objects as meshes with nonzero division level values. By default, FBX division levels are ignored.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle
member.summary: SubD::PatchStyle identifies the style of patch used to fill holes.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle.Unset
member.summary: Not a valid style. This encourages developers to thoughtfully select a patch style and can be used to indicate a UI control is not initialized.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle.Automatic
member.summary: Automatically choose a patch style that will generally create a good looking result. If a hole boundary is not convex, it is triangulated. Otherwise: If a hole has 3 edges, a single triangle face is used. If a hole has 4 edges, a single quad face is used. If a hole has 5 or more edges and an odd number of edges, a triangle fan is used. If a hole has 6 or more edges and an even number of edges, a quad fan is used.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle.SingleFace
member.summary: A single face is used under all conditions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle.TriangleFan
member.summary: A triangle fan used under all conditions. The center of the fan is the average of the hole boundary vertex control net points.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle.QuadOrTriangleFan
member.summary: If the hole boundary has an even number of edges, a quad fan is used. Otherwise a triangle fan is used. The center of the fan is the average of the hole boundary vertex control net points.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDPatchStyle.Triangulated
member.summary: The hole boundary is triangluated. Typically this style is selected when a boundary not convex and the other styles produce faces with overlapping regions.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubD
member.summary: Subdivision surface

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType
member.summary: ON_SubD::NurbsSurfaceType specifies what type of NURBS surfaces are returned by ON_SubD.GetSurfaceNurbsFragments()

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType.Unset
member.summary: Not a valid type. Used to indicate the type has not been set and to encourage developers to explicitly specify a type. When in doubt, specify NurbsSurfaceType::Large.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType.Large
member.summary: Onee NURBS surface will be generated for each SubD quad. N NURBS surfaces will be generated for each SubD N-gon (N = 3, 5 or more). ON_Brepface may cover multiple Near extraordinary vertices, the surfaces may have lots of knots.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType.Medium
member.summary: NURBS surfaces will be as large as possible without the addition of extra knots. Near extraordinary vertices, the surfaces may have lots of knots. This option is preferred when a user wants larger NURBS surfaces but not at the cost of additional NURBS control points.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType.Small
member.summary: NURBS surfaces will not be merged and will have clamped knots.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubD.NurbsSurfaceType.Unprocessed
member.summary: NURBS surfaces will not be merged and will have unclamped uniform knots. This is useful as a starting point for customized merging and modifying continuity at extraordinary vertices.

member.summary: Updates vertex tag, edge tag, and edge coefficient values on the active level. After completing custom editing operations that modify the topology of the SubD control net or changing values of vertex or edge tags, the tag and sector coefficients information on nearby components in the edited areas need to be updated.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions
member.summary: Options used for creating a SubD

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreaseOption
member.summary: Specifies the test used to determine when an interior mesh edge generates an interior SubD creased edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreaseOption.Unset
member.summary: The interior crease test is not defined.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreaseOption.None
member.summary: No interior creases.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreaseOption.AtMeshDoubleEdge
member.summary: An interior mesh double edge will create an interior SubD creased edge. An interior mesh double edge occurs when the sides of two mesh faces have have distinct vertex indices and identical vertex locations.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornerOption
member.summary: Defines how convex corners are treated.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornerOption.Unset
member.summary: The option is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornerOption.None
member.summary: No convex corners. In general,this is the best choice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornerOption.AtMeshCorner
member.summary: A convex subd corner will appear at input mesh boundary vertices where the corner angle <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians() and the number of edges the end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount().

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConcaveCornerOption
member.summary: Defines how concave corners are treated.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConcaveCornerOption.Unset
member.summary: The option is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConcaveCornerOption.None
member.summary: No concave corners. In general, this is the best choice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConcaveCornerOption.AtMeshCorner
member.summary: A concave subd corner will appear at input mesh boundary vertices where the corner angle >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians() and the number of edges the end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount().

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption
member.summary: Specifies how texture coordinate information is transferred from the mesh to the SubD.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption.Unset
member.summary: The option is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption.None
member.summary: No texture coordianate information is transferred from the mesh.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption.Automatic
member.summary: If the mesh has a mapping, then TextureCoordinatesOption::CopyMapping is used. Otherwise if the mesh has texture coordinates, then TextureCoordinatesOption::CopyCoordinates is used. Otherwise TextureCoordinatesOption::Packed is used.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption.Packed
member.summary: No texture coordianate information is transferred from the mesh. The SubD faces are packed.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption.CopyMapping
member.summary: Texture coordinates mapping information is copied from the mesh. Generally this is the best choice because common mappings, like planar, will appear as most people expect on the SubD.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.TextureCoordinateOption.CopyCoordinates
member.summary: If a mesh has custom texture coordinates, the custom texture coordinates are transferred to the SubD. This requires more memory resources, slows subdivision evaluation, often produces unattractive results on n-gons, and distorts the texture when comes from a common mapping technique, like planar. This option may be useful when the mesh contains only triangles and quads and the custom texture coordinates are of high quality.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Create default options

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.Smooth
member.summary: No interior creases and no corners.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreases
member.summary: Create an interior sub-D crease along all input mesh double edges

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornersAndInteriorCreases
member.summary: Look for convex corners at sub-D vertices with 2 edges or fewer that have an included angle 120 degrees.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexAndConcaveCornersAndInteriorCreases
member.summary: Look for convex corners at sub-D vertices with 2 edges or fewer that have an included angle 120 degrees. Look for concave corners at sub-D vertices with 3 edge or more that have an included angle 240 degrees.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.Dispose
member.summary: Delete unmanaged pointer for this

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.InteriorCreaseTest
member.summary: Get or sets the interior crease test option.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConvexCornerTest
member.summary: Get or sets the convex corner test option.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount
member.summary: If ConvexCornerTest == ConvexCornerOption.AtMeshCorner, then an input mesh boundary vertex becomes a SubD corner when the number of edges that end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount edges and the corner angle is <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians
member.summary: If ConvexCornerTest == ConvexCornerOption.AtMeshCorner, then an input mesh boundary vertex becomes a SubD corner when the number of edges that end at the vertex is <= MaximumConvexCornerEdgeCount edges and the corner angle is <= MaximumConvexCornerAngleRadians.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.ConcaveCornerTest
member.summary: Get or sets the concave corner test option.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians
member.summary: If ConcaveCornerTest == ConcaveCornerOption.AtMeshCorner, then an input mesh boundary vertex becomes a SubD corner when the number of edges that end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount edges and the corner angle is >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDCreationOptions.MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount
member.summary: If ConcaveCornerTest == ConcaveCornerOption.AtMeshCorner, then an input mesh boundary vertex becomes a SubD corner when the number of edges that end at the vertex is >= MinimumConcaveCornerEdgeCount edges and the corner angle is >= MinimumConcaveCornerAngleRadians.

summary.para: Provides a set of values describing component state.
This is not a bit field.
Some of these values are mutually exclusive and should not be combined.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Arc
member.summary:
Represents the value of a plane, two angles and a radius in a sub-curve of a three-dimensional circle.
The curve is parameterized by an angle expressed in radians. For an IsValid arc the total subtended angle AngleRadians() = Domain()(1) - Domain()(0) must satisfy 0 < AngleRadians() < 2*Pi
The parameterization of the Arc is inherited from the Circle it is derived from. In particular
t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis
where xaxis and yaxis, (part of Circle.Plane) form an orthonormal frame of the plane containing the circle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.Invalid
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of an invalid arc.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.Unset
member.summary: Gets an Arc with Unset components.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of an arc from a base circle and an angle.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of an arc from a base circle and an interval of angles.
member.param: Increasing angle interval in radians with angleIntervalRadians.Length() <= 2.0*Math.PI.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new arc from a base plane, a radius value and an angle.
member.param: The plane of the arc (arc center will be located at plane origin)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new horizontal arc at the given center point, with a custom radius and angle.

member.param: Alignment plane for arc. The arc will be parallel to this plane.

member.summary: Gets parameter on the arc closest to a test point.
member.returns: Parameter (in radians) of the point on the arc that is closest to the test point. If testPoint is the center of the arc, then the starting point of the arc is (arc.Domain()[0]) returned. If no parameter could be found, RhinoMath.UnsetValue is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Computes the point on an arc that is closest to a test point.
member.returns: The point on the arc that is closest to testPoint. If testPoint is the center of the arc, then the starting point of the arc is returned. UnsetPoint on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.Reverse
member.summary: Reverses the orientation of the arc. Changes the domain from [a,b] to [-b,-a].

member.summary: Transforms the arc using a Transformation matrix.
member.param: Transformations to apply. Note that arcs cannot handle non-euclidean transformations.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.ToNurbsCurve
member.summary: Initializes a nurbs curve representation of this arc. This amounts to the same as calling NurbsCurve.CreateFromArc().
member.returns: A nurbs curve representation of this arc or null if no such representation could be made.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.EpsilonEquals(Rhino.Geometry.Arc,System.Double)
member.summary: Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve
member.summary:
Represent arcs and circles.
ArcCurve.IsCircle returns true if the curve is a complete circle.

remarks.para: an ArcCurve is a sub-curve of a circle, with a constant speed parameterization. The parameterization is an affine linear reparameterization of the underlying arc m_arc onto the domain m_t.
A valid ArcCurve has Radius()>0 and 0<AngleRadians()<=2*PI and a strictly increasing Domain.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance.
Radius is set to 1, position to Origin and Domain to full span (circle).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance, copying values from another .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance, copying values from another .

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Arc,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance, copying values from another and specifying the needed parametrization of the arc.
Arc will not be cut again at these parameterizations.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Circle)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance, copying the shape of a .
Parameterization will be [0;circle.Circumference]

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance, copying values from a and specifying the needed parametrization of the arc.
Circle will not be newly cut at these parameterizations.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion
member.summary: Represents an extrusion, or objects such as beams or linearly extruded elements, that can be represented by profile curves and two miter planes at the extremes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Protected serialization constructor.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.Create(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an extrusion of a 3d curve (which must be planar) and a height.
member.param: If the height > 0, the bottom of the extrusion will be in plane and the top will be height units above the plane. If the height < 0, the top of the extrusion will be in plane and the bottom will be height units below the plane. The plane used is the one that is returned from the curve's TryGetPlane function.
If the curve is closed and cap is true, then the resulting extrusion is capped.
member.returns: If the input is valid, then a new extrusion is returned. Otherwise null is returned

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.Create(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an extrusion from a 3d curve, a plane and a height.
member.param: A plane. The 3d curve is projected to this plane and the result is passed to .

If the height > 0, the bottom of the extrusion will be in plane and the top will be height units above the plane. If the height < 0, the top of the extrusion will be in plane and the bottom will be height units below the plane. The plane used is the one that is returned from the curve's TryGetPlane function.
If the curve is closed and cap is true, then the resulting extrusion is capped.
member.returns: If the input is valid, then a new extrusion is returned. Otherwise null is returned

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.CreateBoxExtrusion(Rhino.Geometry.Box,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an extrusion from a box.
member.param: If true, the base and the top of the box will be capped. Defaults to true.
member.returns: Extrusion on success. null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.CreateCylinderExtrusion(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an extrusion form of a cylinder.
member.param: If true, the end at cylinder.Height1 will be capped.
If true, the end at cylinder.Height2 will be capped.
member.returns: Extrusion on success. null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.CreatePipeExtrusion(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an extrusion form of a pipe.
member.param: If cylinder.Radius is less than other radius, then the cylinder will be the inside of the pipe.
If true, the end at cylinder.Height1 will be capped.
If true, the end at cylinder.Height2 will be capped.
member.returns: Extrusion on success. null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.ToBrep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a brep form of the extrusion. The outer profile is always the first face of the brep. If there are inner profiles, additional brep faces are created for each profile. If the outer profile is closed, then end caps are added as the last two faces of the brep.
member.param: If true and the profiles have kinks, then the faces corresponding to those profiles are split so they will be G1.
member.returns: A brep with a similar shape like this extrusion, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.GetBrepFormComponentIndex(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: Convert a component index that identifies a part of this extrusion to a component index that identifies a part of the Brep created by Extrusion.ToBrep(false).
member.returns: The Brep component index if successful. Otherwise, is returned.

member.summary: Allows to set the two points at the extremes and the up vector.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise false. Setting up=a-b will make the operation fail.

member.summary: Gets or sets the normal of the miter plane at the end in profile coordinates. In profile coordinates, 0,0,1 always maps to the extrusion axis

member.summary: Gets the 3D plane containing the profile curve at a normalized path parameter.

member.summary: Gets the 3D plane perpendicular to the path at a normalized path parameter.

member.remarks: When no mitering is happening, GetPathPlane() and GetProfilePlane() return the same plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.SetOuterProfile(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the outer profile of the extrusion.
member.param: curve in the XY plane or a 2D curve.
If outerProfile is a closed curve, then cap determines if the extrusion has end caps. If outerProfile is an open curve, cap is ignored.
member.returns: true if the profile was set. If the outer profile is closed, then the extrusion may also have inner profiles. If the outer profile is open, the extrusion may not have inner profiles. If the extrusion already has a profile, the set will fail.

member.summary: Adds an inner profile.
member.param: Closed curve in the XY plane or a 2d curve.
member.returns: true if the profile was set.

member.summary: Gets the amount of profile curves.

member.summary: Gets a transversal isocurve of the extruded profile.
member.param: 0 <= profileIndex < ProfileCount The outer profile has index 0.
0.0 <= s <= 1.0 A relative parameter controlling which profile is returned. 0 = bottom profile and 1 = top profile.
member.returns: The profile.

member.summary: Gets one of the profiles.
member.returns: The profile.

member.summary: Gets one of the longitudinal curves along the beam or extrusion.

member.summary: Gets one of the longitudinal surfaces of the extrusion.

member.returns: The surface.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.PathLineCurve
member.summary: Gets the line-like curve that is the conceptual axis of the extrusion.
member.returns: The path as a line curve.

member.summary: Gets the index of the profile curve at a domain related to a parameter.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BezierCurve.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BezierCurve.GetBoundingBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the curve.
member.param: If true, a physically accurate bounding box will be computed. If not, a bounding box estimate will be computed. For some geometry types there is no difference between the estimate and the accurate bounding box. Estimated bounding boxes can be computed much (much) faster than accurate (or "tight") bounding boxes. Estimated bounding boxes are always similar to or larger than accurate bounding boxes.
member.returns: The bounding box of the geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.summary:
Inflates the box with equal amounts in all directions. Inflating with negative amounts may result in decreasing boxes.
Invalid boxes can not be inflated.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Contains(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Tests a point for bounding box inclusion. This is the same as calling Contains(point, false)
member.returns: true if the point is on the inside of or coincident with this bounding box; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Contains(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests a point for BoundingBox inclusion.
member.param: If true, the point needs to be fully on the inside of the BoundingBox. I.e. coincident points will be considered 'outside'.

returns.para: If 'strict' is affirmative, true if the point is inside this bounding box; false if it is on the surface or outside.
If 'strict' is negative, true if the point is on the surface or on the inside of the bounding box; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Contains(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary:
Determines whether this bounding box contains another bounding box.
This is the same as calling Contains(box,false).
member.returns: true if the box is on the inside of this bounding box, or is coincident with the surface of it.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Contains(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Determines whether this bounding box contains another bounding box.
The user can choose how to treat bounding boxes with coincident surfaces.
member.param: If true, the box needs to be fully on the inside of the bounding box. I.e. coincident boxes will be considered 'outside'.
member.returns: true if the box is (strictly) on the inside of this BoundingBox.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.MakeValid
member.summary: Ensures that the box is defined in an increasing fashion along X, Y and Z axes. If the Min or Max points are unset, this function will not change the box.
member.returns: true if the box was made valid, false if the box could not be made valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Corner(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets one of the eight corners of the box.
member.param: true for the minimum on the X axis; false for the maximum.
true for the minimum on the Y axis; false for the maximum.
true for the minimum on the Z axis; false for the maximum.
member.returns: The requested point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.IsDegenerate(System.Double)
member.summary: Determines whether a bounding box is degenerate (flat) in one or more directions.
member.param: Distances <= tolerance will be considered to be zero. If tolerance is negative (default), then a scale invariant tolerance is used.
member.returns: 0 = box is not degenerate 1 = box is a rectangle (degenerate in one direction). 2 = box is a line (degenerate in two directions). 3 = box is a point (degenerate in three directions) 4 = box is not valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.GetCorners
member.summary:
Gets an array filled with the 8 corner points of this box.

member.returns: An array of 8 corners.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.GetEdges
member.summary: Gets an array of the 12 edges of this box.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Transform(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Updates this bounding box to be the smallest axis aligned bounding box that contains the transformed result of its 8 original corner points.
member.returns: true if this operation is successful; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.ToBrep
member.summary: Constructs a representation of this bounding box.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Union(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Updates this BoundingBox to represent the union of itself and another box.
member.param: Box to include in this union.
member.remarks: If either this BoundingBox or the other BoundingBox is InValid, the Valid BoundingBox will be the only one included in the union.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Union(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Updates this BoundingBox to represent the union of itself and a point.
member.param: Point to include in the union.
member.remarks: If this bounding box is InValid then the union will be the BoundingBox containing only the point. If the point is InValid, this BoundingBox will remain unchanged.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Union(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Returns a new BoundingBox that represents the union of boxes a and b.
member.param: First box to include in union.
Second box to include in union.
member.returns: The BoundingBox that contains both a and b.
member.remarks: Invalid boxes are ignored and will not affect the union.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Intersection(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)

member.summary: Returns a new BoundingBox that represents the union of a bounding box and a point.

member.summary: No cap.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType
member.summary: Specifies enumerated constants for all supported loft types.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Normal
member.summary: Uses chord-length parameterization in the loft direction.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Loose
member.summary: The surface is allowed to move away from the original curves to make a smoother surface. The surface control points are created at the same locations as the control points of the loft input curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Tight
member.summary: The surface sticks closely to the original curves. Uses square root of chord-length parameterization in the loft direction.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Straight
member.summary: The sections between the curves are straight. This is also known as a ruled surface.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Developable
member.summary: Obsolete, do not use.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Uniform
member.summary: Constructs a uniform loft. The object knot vectors will be uniform.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.ExtrudeCornerType
member.summary: Corner types used for creating a tapered extrusion

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.ExtrudeCornerType.None
member.summary: No Corner

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BlendType
member.summary: Blend types used for creating filleted Brep edges

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BlendType.Chamfer
member.summary: Creates a ruled surface between brep edges with varying chamfer distances.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BlendType.Fillet
member.summary: Creates a tangent surface between brep edges with varying radius values.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BlendType.Blend
member.summary: Creates a curvature-continuous blend surface between brep edges with varying radius values.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.RailType
member.summary: Rail types used for creating filleted Brep edges

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RailType.DistanceFromEdge
member.summary: The distance from the edge curves determines the intersection.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RailType.RollingBall
member.summary: The radius of a rolling ball determines the intersection.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RailType.DistanceBetweenRails
member.summary: The distance between the edge rails determines the intersection.

member.summary: Rebuild types for creating swept surfaces

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SweepRebuild.None

member.summary: Rebuild cross section curves through points.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SweepRebuild.Refit
member.summary: Refit cross section curves to tolerance.

member.summary: The cross-section curve rotates to maintain its angle to the rail throughout the sweep.

member.summary: Specify an axis for calculating the 3-D rotation of the cross-section.

member.summary: Blend types for creating swept surfaces

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SweepBlend.Local
member.summary: The sweep stays constant at the ends and changes more rapidly in the middle.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SweepBlend.Global
member.summary: The sweep is linearly blended from one end to the other, creating sweeps that taper from one cross-section curve to the other.

member.summary: No mitering

member.summary: If the sweep creates a polysurface with kinks, the component surfaces will be trimmed.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SweepMiter.Untrimmed
member.summary: If the sweep creates a polysurface with kinks, the component surfaces will be untrimmed.

v7_______e6____v6

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsSurface
member.summary:
Returns true if the Brep has a single face and that face is geometrically the same as the underlying surface. I.e., the face has trivial trimming.
In this case, the surface is the first face surface. The flag Brep.Faces[0].OrientationIsReversed records the correspondence between the surface's natural parametric orientation and the orientation of the Brep.
trivial trimming here means that there is only one loop curve in the brep and that loop curve is the same as the underlying surface boundary.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsValidTopology(System.String@)
member.summary: Tests the brep to see if its topology information is valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsValidGeometry(System.String@)
member.summary: Expert user function that tests the brep to see if its geometry information is valid. The value of brep.IsValidTopology() must be true before brep.IsValidGeometry() can be safely called.
member.param: If the brep geometry is not valid, then a brief description of the problem in English is assigned to this out parameter. The information is suitable for low-level debugging purposes by programmers and is not intended to be useful as a high level user interface tool. Otherwise, .
member.returns: A value that indicates whether the geometry is valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsValidTolerancesAndFlags(System.String@)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.BrepVertex.Tolerance
member.summary: Accuracy of vertex point, either >=0.0 or . A value of indicates that the tolerance should be computed. A value of 0.0 indicates that the distance from the vertex to any applicable edge or trim end is <= . If an edge begins or ends at this vertex, then the distance from the vertex's 3d point to the appropriate end of the edge's 3d curve must be <= this tolerance. If a trim begins or ends at this vertex, then the distance from the vertex's 3d point to the 3d point on the surface obtained by evaluating the surface at the appropriate end of the trimming curve must be <= this tolerance.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepVertex.EdgeIndices

member.summary:
Gets or sets the accuracy of the edge curve (>=0.0 or RhinoMath.UnsetValue) A value of UnsetValue indicates that the tolerance should be computed.
The maximum distance from the edge's 3d curve to any surface of a face that has this edge as a portion of its boundary must be <= this tolerance.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType
member.summary: Each brep trim has a defined type.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown type

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Boundary
member.summary: Trim is connected to an edge, is part of an outer, inner or slit loop, and is the only trim connected to the edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Mated
member.summary: Trim is connected to an edge, is part of an outer, inner or slit loop, no other trim from the same loop is connected to the edge, and at least one trim from a different loop is connected to the edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Seam
member.summary: trim is connected to an edge, is part of an outer, inner or slit loop, and one other trim from the same loop is connected to the edge. (There can be other mated trims that are also connected to the edge. For example, the non-manifold edge that results when a surface edge lies in the middle of another surface.) Non-manifold "cuts" have seam trims too.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Singular
member.summary: Trim is part of an outer loop, the trim's 2d curve runs along the singular side of a surface, and the trim is NOT connected to an edge. (There is no 3d edge because the surface side is singular.)

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.CurveOnSurface
member.summary: Trim is connected to an edge, is the only trim in a curve-on-surface loop, and is the only trim connected to the edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.PointOnSurface
member.summary: Trim is a point on a surface, trim.m_pbox is records surface parameters, and is the only trim in a point-on-surface loop. This trim is not connected to an edge and has no 2d curve.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim
member.summary: Brep trim information is stored in BrepTrim classes. Brep.Trims is an array of all the trims in the brep. A BrepTrim is derived from CurveProxy so the trim can supply easy to use evaluation tools via the Curve virtual member functions. Note well that the domains and orientations of the curve m_C2[trim.m_c2i] and the trim as a curve may not agree.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim.GetTolerances(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: The values in tolerance[] record the accuracy of the parameter space trimming curves.

remarks.para: tolerance[0] = accuracy of parameter space curve in first ("u") parameter
tolerance[1] = accuracy of parameter space curve in second ("v") parameter

A value of RhinoMath.UnsetValue indicates that the tolerance should be computed. If the value >= 0.0, then the tolerance is set. If the value is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then the tolerance needs to be computed.

If the trim is not singular, then the trim must have an edge. If P is a 3d point on the edge's curve and surface(u,v) = Q is the point on the surface that is closest to P, then there must be a parameter t in the interval [m_t[0], m_t[1]] such that |u - curve2d(t)[0]| <= tolerance[0] and |v - curve2d(t)[1]| <= tolerance[1]
If P is the 3d point for the vertex brep.m_V[m_vi[k]] and (uk,vk) is the corresponding end of the trim's parameter space curve, then there must be a surface parameter (u,v) such that:

item.description: the distance from the 3d point surface(u,v) to P is <= brep.m_V[m_vi[k]].m_tolerance,

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim.SetTolerances(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The values in tolerance[] record the accuracy of the parameter space trimming curves.

remarks.para: tolerance[0] = accuracy of parameter space curve in first ("u") parameter
tolerance[1] = accuracy of parameter space curve in second ("v") parameter

A value of RhinoMath.UnsetValue indicates that the tolerance should be computed. If the value >= 0.0, then the tolerance is set. If the value is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then the tolerance needs to be computed.

If the trim is not singular, then the trim must have an edge. If P is a 3d point on the edge's curve and surface(u,v) = Q is the point on the surface that is closest to P, then there must be a parameter t in the interval [m_t[0], m_t[1]] such that |u - curve2d(t)[0]| <= tolerance[0] and |v - curve2d(t)[1]| <= tolerance[1]
If P is the 3d point for the vertex brep.m_V[m_vi[k]] and (uk,vk) is the corresponding end of the trim's parameter space curve, then there must be a surface parameter (u,v) such that:

item.description: the distance from the 3d point surface(u,v) to P is <= brep.m_V[m_vi[k]].m_tolerance,

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.ShrinkFaces
member.summary: Shrinks all the underlying surfaces in this Brep. Sometimes the surfaces extend far beyond the trimming boundaries of the Brep Face. This function will remove those portions of the surfaces that are not used.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.Flip(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flips the orientation of faces.
member.param: If true, clears all BrepFace.OrientationIsReversed flags by calling BrepFace.Transpose() on each face with a true OrientationIsReversed setting. If false, all of the faces are flipped regardless of their orientation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.ExtractFace(System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts a face from a Brep.
member.returns: A brep. This can be null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.StandardizeFaceSurface(System.Int32)
member.summary: Standardizes the relationship between a BrepFace and the 3d surface it uses. When done, the face will be the only face that references its 3d surface, and the orientations of the face and 3d surface will be the same.
member.returns: true if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.StandardizeFaceSurfaces
member.summary: Standardize all faces in the brep.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.Add(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create and add a new face to this list. An incomplete face is added. The caller must create and fill in the loops used by the face.
member.param: index of surface in brep's Surfaces list

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.Surface)
member.summary: Add a new face to a brep. This creates a complete face with new vertices at the surface corners, new edges along the surface boundary, etc. The loop of the returned face has four trims that correspond to the south, east, north, and west side of the surface in that order. If you use this version of Add to add an exiting brep, then you are responsible for using a tool like JoinEdges() to hook the new face to its neighbors.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.AddRuledFace(Rhino.Geometry.BrepEdge,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.BrepEdge,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a new face to the brep whose surface geometry is a ruled surface between two edges.
member.param: The south side of the face's surface will run along edgeA.
true if the new face's outer boundary orientation along edgeA is opposite the orientation of edgeA.
The north side of the face's surface will run along edgeA
true if the new face's outer boundary orientation along edgeB is opposite the orientation of edgeB

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.AddConeFace(Rhino.Geometry.BrepVertex,Rhino.Geometry.BrepEdge,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a new face to the brep whose surface geometry is a ruled cone with the edge as the base and the vertex as the apex point.
member.param: The apex of the cone will be at this vertex. The north side of the surface's parameter space will be a singular point at the vertex.
The south side of the face's surface will run along this edge.
true if the new face's outer boundary orientation along the edge is opposite the orientation of edge.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepTrimList.Add(System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new trim that will be part of an inner, outer, or slit loop to the brep.
member.returns: New Trim
member.remarks: You should set the trim's Tolerance, TrimType, and IsoStatus values. In general, you should try to use the Add( edge, bRev3d, loop, c2i ) version of NewTrim. If you want to add a singular trim, use AddSingularTrim. If you want to add a curve-on-surface trim, use AddCurveOnFace. If you want to add a point-on-surface trim, use AddPointOnFace.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.BrepLoopType)
member.summary: Create a new empty boundary loop. The new loop will not be part of a face and will not include any trim curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.BrepLoopType,Rhino.Geometry.BrepFace)
member.summary: Create a new boundary loop on a face. After you get this BrepLoop, you still need to create the vertices, edges, and trims that define the loop.
member.returns: New loop that needs to be filled in

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList.AddOuterLoop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new outer boundary loop that runs along the sides of the face's surface. All the necessary trims, edges, and vertices are created and added to the brep.
member.param: index of face that needs an outer boundary that runs along the sides of its surface.
member.returns: New outer boundary loop that is complete.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList.AddPlanarFaceLoop(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.BrepLoopType,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve})
member.summary: Add a planar trimming loop to a planar face
member.param: index of planar face. The underlying surface must be a PlaneSurface

type of loop to add. If loopType is Unknown, then the loop direction is tested and the new loops type will be set to Outer or Inner. If the loopType is Outer, then the direction of the new loop is tested and flipped if it is clockwise. If the loopType is Inner, then the direction of the new loop is tested and flipped if it is counter-clockwise.
list of 3d curves that form a simple (no self intersections) closed curve. These curves define the 3d edge geometry and should be near the planar surface.
member.returns: new loop if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexList.SetVertex(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex to the Vertex List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.
If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshTopologyVertexList.SortEdges
member.summary: Sorts the edge list for the mesh topology vertex list so that the edges are in radial order when you call ConnectedTopologyVertices. A non-manifold edge is treated as a boundary edge with respect to sorting. If any boundary or non-manifold edges end at the vertex, then the first edge will be a boundary or non-manifold edge.
member.returns: true on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshTopologyVertexList.SortEdges(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts the edge list for as single mesh topology vertex so that the edges are in radial order when you call ConnectedTopologyVertices. A non-manifold edge is treated as a boundary edge with respect to sorting. If any boundary or non-manifold edges end at the vertex, then the first edge will be a boundary or non-manifold edge.
member.param: index of a topology vertex in Mesh.TopologyVertices>
member.returns: true on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshTopologyVertexList.IsHidden(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the topological vertex is hidden. The mesh topology vertex is hidden if and only if all the ON_Mesh vertices it represents is hidden.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.ConvertQuadsToTriangles
member.summary: Splits all quads along the short diagonal.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.ConvertNonPlanarQuadsToTriangles(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits non-planar quads into two triangles based on given parameters.
member.param: If planarTolerance >= 0, then a quad is split if its vertices are not coplanar. If both planarTolerance = Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetValue and angleToleranceRadians >= 0.0, then the planarity test is skipped.

If angleToleranceRadians >= 0.0, then a quad is split if the angle between opposite corner normals is > angleToleranceRadians. The corner normal is the normal to the triangle formed by two adjacent edges and the diagonal connecting their endpoints. A quad has four corner normals. If both angleToleranceRadians = Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetValue and planarTolerance >= 0.0, then the corner normal angle test is skipped.

0 default Currently divides along the short diagonal. This may be changed as better methods are found or preferences change. By passing zero, you let the developers of this code decide what's best for you over time. 1 divide along the short diagonal 2 divide along the long diagonal 3 minimize resulting area 4 maximize resulting area 5 minimize angle between triangle normals 6 maximize angle between triangle normals
member.returns: Number of quads that were converted to triangles.
member.remarks: If both planarTolerance = Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetValue and angleToleranceRadians = Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then all quads are split.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.ConvertTrianglesToQuads(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Joins adjacent triangles into quads if the resulting quad is 'nice'.
member.param: Used to compare adjacent triangles' face normals. For two triangles to be considered, the angle between their face normals has to be <= angleToleranceRadians. When in doubt use RhinoMath.PI/90.0 (2 degrees).

( <= 1.0) For two triangles to be considered the ratio of the resulting quad's diagonals (length of the shortest diagonal)/(length of longest diagonal). has to be >= minimumDiagonalLengthRatio. When in doubt us .875.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.CullDegenerateFaces
member.summary:
Attempts to removes degenerate faces from the mesh.
Degenerate faces are faces that contains such a combination of indices, that their final shape collapsed in a line or point.
Before returning, this method also attempts to repair faces by juggling vertex indices.
member.returns: The number of degenerate faces that were removed.

member.returns: true if hidden, false if fully visible.

member.param: true if the ngon is permitted to have interior holes, false otherwise.
member.returns: 1: The ngon does not have holes, the ngon's faces are compatibly oriented, and the ngon's outer boundary orientation matches the faces' orientation. -1: The ngon does not have holes, the ngon's faces are compatibly oriented, and the ngon's outer boundary orientation is opposite the faces' orientation. 0: Otherwise.The ngon may be invalid, have holes, the ngon's faces may not be compatibly oriented, the ngons edges may not have a consistent orientation with respect to the faces, or some other issue.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshNgonList.IsValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tests an ngon to see if the vertex and face references are valid and pass partial boundary validity checks.

member.remarks: If the return value is > MeshNgon.BoundaryVertexCount, then the ngon has either inner boundaries or duplicate vertices.

member.summary: Tests an ngon to see if the vertex and face references are valid and pass partial boundary validity checks.
member.param: The index of the ngon to test.
A text log for collecting information about problems.

member.remarks: If the return value is > MeshNgon.BoundaryVertexCount, then the ngon has either inner boundaries or duplicate vertices.

member.summary: Adds a new vertex color to the end of the color list.

Green component of color, must be in the 0~255 range.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.Add(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Adds a new vertex color to the end of the color list.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.SetColor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex color to the color List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.
If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.
member.param: Index of vertex color to set. If index equals Count, then the color will be appended.
Red component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
Green component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
Blue component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.SetColor(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex to the Vertex List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.
If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.
member.param: Index of vertex color to set. If index equals Count, then the color will be appended.
Color to set, Alpha channels will be ignored.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.summary:
Transposes texture coordinates.
The region of the bitmap the texture uses does not change. All texture coordinates rows (Us) become columns (Vs), and vice versa.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshTextureCoordinateList.ReverseTextureCoordinates(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reverses one coordinate direction of the texture coordinates.
The region of the bitmap the texture uses does not change. Either Us or Vs direction is flipped.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.summary: If you want to keep a copy of this class around by holding onto it in a variable after a command completes, call EnsurePrivateCopy to make sure that this class is not tied to the document. You can call this function as many times as you want.

member.summary: Inserts a knot and update control point locations. Does not change parameterization or locus of curve.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.summary: Inserts a knot and update control point locations. Does not change parameterization or locus of curve.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.summary: Get knot multiplicity.
member.returns: The multiplicity (valence) of the knot.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurveKnotList.CreateUniformKnots(System.Double)
member.summary: Compute a clamped, uniform knot vector based on the current degree and control point count. Does not change values of control vertices.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurveKnotList.IsClampedStart
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the knot vector is clamped at the start of the curve. Clamped curves start at the first control-point. This requires fully multiple knots.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurveKnotList.IsClampedEnd
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the knot vector is clamped at the end of the curve. Clamped curves are coincident with the first and last control-point. This requires fully multiple knots.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurveKnotList.ClampEnd(Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd)
member.summary: Clamp end knots. Does not modify control point locations.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurveKnotList.SuperfluousKnot(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Computes the knots that are superfluous because they are not used in NURBs evaluation. These make it appear so that the first and last curve spans are different from interior spans.
http://wiki.mcneel.com/developer/onsuperfluousknot
member.param: true if the query targets the first knot. Otherwise, the last knot.
member.returns: A component.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurveKnotList.KnotStyle
member.summary: Gets the style of the knot vector.

member.summary: Checks that all values in the other list are sequentially equal within epsilon to the values in this list.
member.returns: True if values are, orderly, equal within epsilon. False otherwise.

member.returns: The index, or -1 if no index is found.

member.summary: Gets the number of control points in this curve.

member.summary: Gets or sets the control point location at the given index.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.ControlPolygonLength
member.summary: Gets the length of the polyline connecting all control points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.ControlPolygon
member.summary: Constructs a polyline through all the control points. Note that periodic curves generate a closed polyline with fewer points than control-points.
member.returns: A polyline connecting all control points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.ChangeEndWeights(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Use a combination of scaling and reparameterization to change the end weights to the specified values.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: The domain, Euclidean locations of the control points, and locus of the curve do not change, but the weights, homogeneous CV values and internal knot values may change. If w0 and w1 are 1 and the curve is not rational, the curve is not changed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.MakeRational
member.summary: Converts the curve to a Rational NURBS curve. Rational NURBS curves have weighted control points.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.MakeNonRational
member.summary: Converts the curve to a Non-rational NURBS curve. Non-rational curves have unweighted control points.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.SetPoint(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets a world 3-D, or Euclidean, control point at the given index. The 4-D representation is (x, y, z, 1.0).
member.param: Index of control point to set.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.SetPoint(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets a homogeneous control point at the given index, where the 4-D representation is (x, y, z, w). The world 3-D, or Euclidean, representation is (x/w, y/w, z/w).
member.param: Index of control point to set.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: For expert use only. If you do not understand homogeneous coordinates, then use an override that accepts world 3-D, or Euclidean, coordinates as input.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.SetPoint(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Sets a world 3-D, or Euclidean, control point at the given index. The 4-D representation is (x, y, z, 1.0).
member.param: Index of control point to set.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.SetPoint(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Point4d)
member.summary: Sets a homogeneous control point at the given index, where the 4-D representation is (x, y, z, w). The world 3-D, or Euclidean, representation is (x/w, y/w, z/w).
member.param: Index of control point to set.
Coordinate and weight of control point.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: For expert use only. If you do not understand homogeneous coordinates, then use an override that accepts world 3-D, or Euclidean, coordinates as input.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.SetPoint(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double)

member.param: Index of control point to set.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.summary: Gets a world 3-D, or Euclidean, control point at the given index. The 4-D representation is (x, y, z, 1.0).
member.param: Index of control point to get.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.summary: Gets a homogeneous control point at the given index, where the 4-D representation is (x, y, z, w). The world 3-D, or Euclidean, representation is (x/w, y/w, z/w).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsSurfaceKnotList.SuperfluousKnot(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Computes the knots that are superfluous because they are not used in NURBs evaluation. These make it appear so that the first and last surface spans are different from interior spans.
http://wiki.mcneel.com/developer/onsuperfluousknot
member.param: true if the query targets the first knot. Otherwise, the last knot.
member.returns: A component.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Circle
member.summary:
Represents a circle in 3D.
The values used are a radius and an orthonormal frame of the plane containing the circle, with origin at the center.
The circle is parameterized by radians from 0 to 2 Pi given by
t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis
where center, xaxis and yaxis define the orthonormal frame of the circle plane.
member.remarks: >An IsValid circle has positive radius and an IsValid plane defining the frame.

member.summary: Try to fit a circle to two curves using tangent relationships.
member.param: Parameter on first curve close to desired solution.
Parameter on second curve closet to desired solution.
member.returns: Valid circle on success, Circle.Unset on failure.

member.summary: Try to fit a circle to three curves using tangent relationships.
member.param: Parameter on first curve close to desired solution.
Parameter on second curve closet to desired solution.
Parameter on third curve close to desired solution.
member.returns: Valid circle on success, Circle.Unset on failure.

member.summary: Gets a circle with Unset components.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.ComponentStatus
member.summary:
Provides information about selection, highlighting, visibility, editability and integrity states of a component.
This structure is immutable.
