member.summary: Only used to create from named states.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ComponentStatus.#ctor(System.Byte)
member.summary: Used in marshaling. Do NOT expose this. This will ensure the same type safety present in OpenNURBS.

member.summary: This is the default value and equal to undefined.

member.summary: The selection flag is checked.

member.summary: The locked flag is checked.

member.summary: The damaged flag is checked.

member.summary: True if every setting is 0 or false.

member.summary: Returns false if component is not damaged. True otherwise.

member.summary: Returns true if highlighted. False otherwise.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ComponentStatus.IsHidden

member.returns: The component status for hidden.

member.returns: The component status for locked.

member.summary: Returns true if selected persistent. False otherwise.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Cone
member.summary: Represents the center plane, radius and height values in a right circular cone.

member.summary: Gets an invalid Cone.

member.summary: Initializes a new cone with a specified base plane, height and radius.
member.param: Base plane of cone. The apex of the cone is at the plane's origin.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.Plane
member.summary: Gets or sets the base plane of the cone. The apex of the cone is at the plane's origin.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the circular right cone.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the cone.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.IsValid
member.summary: true if plane is valid, height is not zero and radius is not zero.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.BasePoint
member.summary: Center of base circle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.ApexPoint
member.summary: Point at tip of the cone.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.Axis
member.summary: Unit vector axis of cone.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.AngleInRadians
member.summary: Computes the angle (in radians) between the axis and the side of the cone. The angle and the height have the same sign.
member.returns: Math.Atan(Radius / Height) if the height is not 0; 0 if the radius is 0; Math.PI otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.AngleInDegrees
member.summary: Computes the angle (in degrees) between the axis and the side of the cone. The angle and the height have the same sign.
member.returns: An angle in degrees.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.ToNurbsSurface
member.summary: Constructs a Nurbs surface representation of this Cone. This is synonymous with calling NurbsSurface.CreateFromCone().
member.returns: A Nurbs surface representation of the cone or null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.ToRevSurface
member.summary: Constructs a RevSurface representation of this Cone. This is synonymous with calling RevSurface.CreateFromCone().
member.returns: A RevSurface representation of the cone or null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.ToBrep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a Brep representation of the cone with a single face for the cone, an edge along the cone seam, and vertices at the base and apex ends of this seam edge. The optional cap is a single face with one circular edge starting and ending at the base vertex.
member.param: true if the bottom should be filled with a surface. false otherwise.
member.returns: A brep (polysurface) representation of this cone values.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.EpsilonEquals(Rhino.Geometry.Cone,System.Double)
member.summary: Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BlendContinuity
member.summary: Used in curve and surface blending and matching functions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BlendContinuity.Position
member.summary: G0: The curves or surfaces touch at the join point (position).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BlendContinuity.Tangency
member.summary: G1: The curves or surfaces also share a common tangent direction at the join point (tangent).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BlendContinuity.Curvature
member.summary: G2: The curves or surfaces also share a common center of curvature at the join point (curvature).

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.PreserveEnd
member.summary: Preserves, or maintains, the shape of the opposite the one being edited.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PreserveEnd.None
member.summary: No constraint.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PreserveEnd.Position
member.summary: Location only.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PreserveEnd.Tangency
member.summary: Position and curve direction.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PreserveEnd.Curvature

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for all implemented corner styles in curve offsets.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.None
member.summary: The default value.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Sharp
member.summary: Offsets and extends curves with a straight line until they intersect.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Round
member.summary: Offsets and fillets curves with an arc of radius equal to the offset distance.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Smooth
member.summary: Offsets and connects curves with a smooth (G1 continuity) curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Chamfer
member.summary: Offsets and connects curves with a straight line between their endpoints.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetEndStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for all implemented end styles in curve offsets.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetEndStyle.None
member.summary: No closing segments are added.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetEndStyle.Flat
member.summary: Straight-line segments are added between the curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetEndStyle.Round
member.summary: Tangent arcs are added between the curves.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for knot spacing styles in interpolated curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.Uniform
member.summary: Parameter spacing between consecutive knots is 1.0.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.Chord
member.summary: Chord length spacing, requires degree=3 with CV1 and CVn1 specified.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.ChordSquareRoot
member.summary: Square root of chord length, requires degree=3 with CV1 and CVn1 specified.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.UniformPeriodic
member.summary: Periodic with uniform spacing.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.ChordPeriodic
member.summary: Periodic with chord length spacing.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.ChordSquareRootPeriodic
member.summary: Periodic with square root of chord length spacing.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for closed curve orientations.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation.Undefined
member.summary: Unable to compute the curve's orientation.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation.Clockwise
member.summary: The curve's orientation is clockwise in the XY plane.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation.CounterClockwise
member.summary: The curve's orientation is counter clockwise in the XY plane.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for closed curve/point spatial relationships.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Unset
member.summary: Relation is meaningless.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Inside
member.summary: Point is on the interior of the region implied by the closed curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Outside
member.summary: Point is on the exterior of the region implied by the closed curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Coincident
member.summary: Point is coincident with the curve and therefore neither inside not outside.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for closed curve/closed curve relationships.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.Disjoint
member.summary: There is no common area between the two regions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.MutualIntersection
member.summary: The two curves intersect. There is therefore no full containment relationship either way.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.AInsideB
member.summary: Region bounded by curveA (first curve) is inside of curveB (second curve).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.BInsideA
member.summary: Region bounded by curveB (second curve) is inside of curveA (first curve).

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for styles to use during curve extension, such as "Line", "Arc" or "Smooth".

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle.Line
member.summary: Curve ends will be propagated linearly according to tangents.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle.Arc
member.summary: Curve ends will be propagated arc-wise according to curvature.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle.Smooth
member.summary: Curve ends will be propagated smoothly according to curvature.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions
member.summary: Enumerates the options to use when simplifying a curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.None
member.summary: No option is specified.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.SplitAtFullyMultipleKnots
member.summary: Split NurbsCurves at fully multiple knots. Effectively turning single NURBS segments with kinks into multiple segments.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildLines
member.summary: Replace linear segments with LineCurves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildArcs
member.summary: Replace partially circular segments with ArcCurves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildRationals
member.summary: Replace rational NURBS curve with constant weights with an equivalent non-rational NurbsCurve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.AdjustG1
member.summary: Adjust Curves at G1-joins.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.Merge
member.summary: Merge adjacent co-linear lines or co-circular arcs or combine consecutive line segments into a polyline.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.All
member.summary: Implies all of the simplification functions will be used.

member.summary: The tail part of the curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd.Both

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Curve
member.summary:
Represents a base class that is common to most RhinoCommon curve types.
A curve represents an entity that can be all visited by providing a single parameter, usually called t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateControlPointCurve(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point3d},System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a curve from a set of control-point locations.
member.param: Degree of curve. The number of control points must be at least degree+1.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateControlPointCurve(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point3d})
member.summary: Constructs a control-point of degree=3 (or less).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.JoinCurves(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve})
member.summary: Joins a collection of curve segments together.
member.returns: An array of joined curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.JoinCurves(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},System.Double)
member.summary: Joins a collection of curve segments together.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of curve segments to join.
Joining tolerance, i.e. the distance between segment end-points that is allowed.
member.returns: An array of joined curves. This array can be empty.
member.exception: If inputCurves is null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.JoinCurves(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Joins a collection of curve segments together.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of curve segments to join.
Joining tolerance, i.e. the distance between segment end-points that is allowed.

param.name: preserveDirection
param.para: If true, curve endpoints will be compared to curve start points.
If false, all start and endpoints will be compared and copies of input curves may be reversed in output.

member.returns: An array of joined curves. This array can be empty.
member.exception: If inputCurves is null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.summary: Protected serialization constructor for internal use.

member.summary:
For derived classes implementers.
Defines the necessary implementation to free the instance from being constant.

member.summary: Gets or sets the domain of the curve.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Dimension
member.summary:
Gets the dimension of the object.
The dimension is typically three. For parameter space trimming curves the dimension is two. In rare cases the dimension can be one or greater than three.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ChangeDimension(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the dimension of a curve.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsLinear
member.summary: Test a curve to see if it is linear to within RhinoMath.ZeroTolerance units (1e-12).
member.returns: true if the curve is linear.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsLinear(System.Double)
member.summary: Test a curve to see if it is linear to within the custom tolerance.
member.param: Tolerance to use when checking linearity.
member.returns: true if the ends of the curve are farther than tolerance apart and the maximum distance from any point on the curve to the line segment connecting the curve ends is <= tolerance.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsPolyline
member.summary: Several types of Curve can have the form of a polyline including a degree 1 NurbsCurve, a PolylineCurve, and a PolyCurve all of whose segments are some form of polyline. IsPolyline tests a curve to see if it can be represented as a polyline.
member.returns: true if this curve can be represented as a polyline; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.TryGetPolyline(Rhino.Geometry.Polyline@)
member.summary: Several types of Curve can have the form of a polyline including a degree 1 NurbsCurve, a PolylineCurve, and a PolyCurve all of whose segments are some form of polyline. IsPolyline tests a curve to see if it can be represented as a polyline.
member.param: If true is returned, then the polyline form is returned here.
member.returns: true if this curve can be represented as a polyline; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.TryGetPolyline(Rhino.Geometry.Polyline@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Several types of Curve can have the form of a polyline including a degree 1 NurbsCurve, a PolylineCurve, and a PolyCurve all of whose segments are some form of polyline. IsPolyline tests a curve to see if it can be represented as a polyline.
member.param: If true is returned, then the polyline form is returned here.
if true is returned, then the parameters of the polyline points are returned here.
member.returns: true if this curve can be represented as a polyline; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.

member.returns: true if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return false.
If greater than 0.0 and none of the interior sampled points are at least minimumAbsoluteSize from start, this function will return false.
If greater than 1.0 and chord length is less than minimumRelativeSize*gap, this function will return false.
member.returns: true if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation
member.summary: Determines the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed, planar curve in the world XY plane. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed, planar curves.
member.returns: The orientation of this curve with respect to world XY plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Determines the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed, planar curve in a given plane. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed, planar curves.
member.returns: The orientation of this curve with respect to a defined up direction.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Determines the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed, planar curve in a given plane. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed, planar curves.
member.param: The plane in which to solve the orientation.
member.returns: The orientation of this curve in the given plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)

member.returns: The orientation of this curve in the world XY-plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.TorsionAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluate the torsion of a curve at a parameter. Sometimes also called the "second curvature", torsion is the rate of change of a curve's osculating plane.

member.remarks: See Barrett O'Neill, Elementary Differential Geometry, page 69.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetNextDiscontinuity(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: Type of continuity to search for.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity() and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 it will be ignored unless continuityType is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
If a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns:
Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): true if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains.
Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): true if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetNextDiscontinuity(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: Type of continuity to search for.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity() and step through the discontinuities.

default = cos(1 degree) Used only when continuity is G1_continuous or G2_continuous. If the cosine of the angle between two tangent vectors is <= cos_angle_tolerance, then a G1 discontinuity is reported.

(default = ON_SQRT_EPSILON) Used only when continuity is G2_continuous. If K0 and K1 are curvatures evaluated from above and below and |K0 - K1| > curvature_tolerance, then a curvature discontinuity is reported.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 it will be ignored unless continuityType is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
If a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns:
Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): true if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains.
Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): true if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.summary: Splits (divides) the curve at a series of specified parameters. The parameter must be in the interior of the curve domain.

member.returns: Multiple curves on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Does a NURBS curve representation of this curve exist?
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the curve's to the desired accuracy 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the curve's and the domain of the NURBS curve is correct. However, This curve's parameterization and the NURBS curve parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of curves that have a transcendental parameterization like circles.

member.summary: Constructs a NURBS curve representation of this curve.

member.returns: NURBS representation of the curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity
member.summary: Provides enumerated values for continuity along geometry, such as continuous first derivative or continuous unit tangent and curvature.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.None
member.summary: There is no continuity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C0_continuous
member.summary: Continuous Function : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C1_continuous
member.summary: Continuous first derivative : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C2_continuous
member.summary: Continuous first derivative and second derivative : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G1_continuous
member.summary: Continuous unit tangent : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G2_continuous
member.summary: Continuous unit tangent and curvature : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C0_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous function : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C1_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous first derivative : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C2_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous first and second derivative : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G1_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous unit tangent : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G2_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous unit tangent and curvature : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.summary: Analytic discontinuity. Cinfinity_continuous is a euphemism for "at a knot".

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.AngularDimension.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Constructs an angular dimension from parameters.

members.member:
Constructs an angular dimension between the lines.
If the lines intersect in a single point, that point is used as the center of the angular dimension arc.In this case, there are eight possible angles to dimension.The pointOnAngularDimensionArc and pointOnLine parameters are used to select the correct angle to dimension. If a pointOnLine parameter is not set, the corresponding line's midpoint is used.
If the lines are colinear, the point on the line closest to pointOnAngularDimensionArc is the center of the angular dimension arc.
The first line.
If specified, indicates which semi-infinite portion of line1 to dimension. Otherwise the midpoint of line1 as a segment is used. When in doubt, use Point3d.Unset.
The second line. If specified, indicates which semi-infinite portion of line2 to dimension. Otherwise the midpoint of line2 as a segment is used. When in doubt, use Point3d.Unset.
A point on the interior of the angular dimension arc.
If bSetExtensionPoints is true, and a pointOnLine parameter is valid, that point is used as the extension point. Otherwise the angular dimension arc endpoint is used.
8.0

member.summary: Creates an angular dimension with extension lines starting at plane origin (arc center).
member.returns: The angular dimension if successful, null otherwise.

member.summary: Updates dimension geometry from point locations.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.AngularDimension.AdjustFromPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Update angular dimension from point locations.
member.returns: True if successful, false otherwise.

members.member:
The angle between the lines is dimensioned.
If the lines intersect in a single point, that point is used as the center of the angular dimension arc.In this case, there are eight possible angles to dimension.The pointOnAngularDimensionArc and pointOnLine parameters are used to select the correct angle to dimension. If a pointOnLine parameter is not set, the corresponding line's midpoint is used.
If the lines are colinear, the point on the line closest to pointOnAngularDimensionArc is the center of the angular dimension arc.
Dimension style. The first line.
If specified, indicates which semi-infinite portion of line1 to dimension. Otherwise the midpoint of line1 as a segment is used. When in doubt, use Point3d.Unset.
The second line. If specified, indicates which semi-infinite portion of line2 to dimension. Otherwise the midpoint of line2 as a segment is used. When in doubt, use Point3d.Unset.
A point on the interior of the angular dimension arc.
If bSetExtensionPoints is true, and a pointOnLine parameter is valid, that point is used as the extension point. Otherwise the angular dimension arc endpoint is used.
The angular dimension if successful, null otherwise. 8.0

member.summary: Is called when a non-constant operation occurs.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.IsDocumentControlled
member.summary: If true this object may not be modified. Any properties or functions that attempt to modify this object when it is set to "IsReadOnly" will throw a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.DuplicateShallow
member.summary: Constructs a light copy of this object. By "light", it is meant that the same underlying data is used until something is done to attempt to change it. For example, you could have a shallow copy of a very heavy mesh object and the same underlying data will be used when doing things like inspecting the number of faces on the mesh. If you modify the location of one of the mesh vertices, the shallow copy will create a full duplicate of the underlying mesh data and the shallow copy will become a deep copy.
member.returns:
An object of the same type as this object.
This behavior is overridden by implementing classes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.Duplicate
member.summary: Constructs a deep (full) copy of this object.
member.returns: An object of the same type as this, with the same properties and behavior.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.Transform(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Transforms the geometry. If the input Transform has a SimilarityType of OrientationReversing, you may want to consider flipping the transformed geometry after calling this function when it makes sense. For example, you may want to call Flip() on a Brep after transforming it.
member.returns: true if geometry successfully transformed.

member.summary: Rotates the object about the specified axis. A positive rotation angle results in a counter-clockwise rotation about the axis (right hand rule).
member.param: Direction of the axis of rotation.
Point on the axis of rotation.
member.returns: true if geometry successfully rotated.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.MemoryEstimate
member.summary: Computes an estimate of the number of bytes that this object is using in memory.
member.returns: An estimated memory footprint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.DataCRC(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns a CRC calculated from the information that defines the object. This CRC can be used as a quick way to see if two objects are not identical.
member.returns: CRC of the information the defines the object.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the geometry.
member.param: If true, a physically accurate bounding box will be computed. If not, a bounding box estimate will be computed. For some geometry types there is no difference between the estimate and the accurate bounding box. Estimated bounding boxes can be computed much (much) faster than accurate (or "tight") bounding boxes. Estimated bounding boxes are always similar to or larger than accurate bounding boxes.
member.returns: The bounding box of the geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Aligned Bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the transformed geometry.
member.param: Transformation to apply to object prior to the BoundingBox computation. The geometry itself is not modified.
member.returns: The accurate bounding box of the transformed geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Aligned Bounding box solver. Gets the plane aligned bounding box.
member.returns: A BoundingBox in plane coordinates.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Box@)
member.summary: Aligned Bounding box solver. Gets the plane aligned bounding box.
member.returns: A BoundingBox in plane coordinates.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Hatch
member.summary: Represents a hatch in planar boundary loop or loops. This is a 2d entity with a plane defining a local coordinate system. The loops, patterns, angles, etc are all in this local coordinate system. The Hatch object manages the plane and loop array Fill definitions are in the HatchPattern or class derived from HatchPattern Hatch has an index to get the pattern definition from the pattern table.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection
member.summary: Provides static methods for the computation of intersections, projections, sections and similar.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Line,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Intersects two lines.
member.param: Parameter on lineA that is closest to LineB. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
Parameter on lineB that is closest to LineA. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
If tolerance > 0.0, then an intersection is reported only if the distance between the points is <= tolerance. If tolerance <= 0.0, then the closest point between the lines is reported.
If true, the input lines are treated as finite segments. If false, the input lines are treated as infinite lines.
member.returns: true if a closest point can be calculated and the result passes the tolerance parameter test; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Line,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Find the unique closest-points pair between two infinite lines, if it exists.
member.param: Parameter on lineA that is closest to lineB.
Parameter on lineB that is closest to lineA. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
member.returns:
true if points are found and false if the lines are numerically parallel. Numerically parallel means the 2x2 matrix:
+AoA -AoB
-AoB +BoB is numerically singular, where A = (lineA.To - lineA.From) and B = (lineB.To-lineB.From).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LinePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double@)
member.summary: Intersects a line and a plane. This function only returns true if the intersection result is a single point (i.e. if the line is coincident with the plane then no intersection is assumed).
member.param: Parameter on line where intersection occurs. If the parameter is not within the {0, 1} Interval then the finite segment does not intersect the plane.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlanePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Line@)
member.summary: Intersects two planes and return the intersection line. If the planes are parallel or coincident, no intersection is assumed.
member.param: If this function returns true, the intersectionLine parameter will return the line where the planes intersect.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlanePlanePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects three planes to find the single point they all share.
member.param: Point where all three planes converge.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure. If at least two out of the three planes are parallel or coincident, failure is assumed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlaneCircle(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Intersects a plane with a circle using exact calculations.
member.param: First intersection parameter on circle if successful or RhinoMath.UnsetValue if not.
Second intersection parameter on circle if successful or RhinoMath.UnsetValue if not.
member.returns: The type of intersection that occurred.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlaneSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Circle@)
member.summary: Intersects a plane with a sphere using exact calculations.
member.returns: If is returned, the intersectionCircle has a radius of zero and the center point is the point on the plane closest to the sphere.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineCircle(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects a line with a circle using exact calculations.
member.param: Parameter on line for first intersection.
Point on circle closest to first intersection.
Parameter on line for second intersection.
Point on circle closest to second intersection.
member.returns: If is returned, only t1 and point1 will have valid values. If is returned, t2 and point2 will also be filled out.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects a line with a sphere using exact calculations.
member.returns: If is returned, the first point is the point on the line closest to the sphere and the second point is the point on the sphere closest to the line. If is returned, the first point is the point on the line and the second point is the same point on the sphere.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects a line with a cylinder using exact calculations.
member.returns:
If None is returned, the first point is the point on the line closest to the cylinder and the second point is the point on the cylinder closest to the line.
If is returned, the first point is the point on the line and the second point is the same point on the cylinder.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.SphereSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Circle@)
member.summary: Intersects two spheres using exact calculations.
member.param: If intersection is a point, then that point will be the center, radius 0.
member.returns: The intersection type.

member.summary: Intersects two circles using exact calculations.
member.returns: The intersection type.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineBox(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Intersects an infinite line and an axis aligned bounding box.
member.param: If tolerance > 0.0, then the intersection is performed against a box that has each side moved out by tolerance.
The chord from line.PointAt(lineParameters.T0) to line.PointAt(lineParameters.T1) is the intersection.

member.summary: Intersects an infinite line with a box volume.

The chord from line.PointAt(lineParameters.T0) to line.PointAt(lineParameters.T1) is the intersection.
member.returns: true if the line intersects the box, false if no intersection occurs.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SetAttenuation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Sets the attenuation settings (ignored for "directional" and "ambient" lights).
attenuation = 1/(a0 + d*a1 + d^2*a2) where d = distance to light.
member.param: The new constant attenuation divisor term.
The new reverse linear attenuation divisor term.
The new reverse quadratic attenuation divisor term.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.AttenuationVector
member.summary: Gets or Sets the attenuation vector.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Light.GetAttenuation(System.Double)
member.summary:
Gets the attenuation settings (ignored for "directional" and "ambient" lights).
attenuation = 1/(a0 + d*a1 + d^2*a2) where d = distance to light.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotAngleRadians
member.summary:
Gets or sets the spot angle in radians.
Ignored for non-spot lights.
angle = 0 to pi/2 (0 to 90 degrees).

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotExponent
member.summary: The spot exponent varies from 0.0 to 128.0 and provides an exponential interface for controlling the focus or concentration of a spotlight (like the OpenGL GL_SPOT_EXPONENT parameter). The spot exponent and hot spot parameters are linked; changing one will change the other. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.HotSpot
member.summary: The hot spot setting runs from 0.0 to 1.0 and is used to provides a linear interface for controlling the focus or concentration of a spotlight. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of values.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If the absolute value of a pivot is <= zero_tolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
an array of RowCount values that is row reduced with the matrix.
the value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[],System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of 3d points.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If the absolute value of a pivot is <= zero_tolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
An array of RowCount 3d points that is row reduced with the matrix.
The value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.BackSolve(System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: Solves M*x=b where M is upper triangular with a unit diagonal and b is a column of values.
member.param: (>=0.0) used to test for "zero" values in b in under determined systems of equations.
The values in B[RowCount],...,B[B.Length-1] are tested to make sure they are within "zeroTolerance".
member.returns: Array of length ColumnCount on success. null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.BackSolvePoints(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Solves M*x=b where M is upper triangular with a unit diagonal and b is a column of 3d points.
member.param: (>=0.0) used to test for "zero" values in b in under determined systems of equations.
The values in B[RowCount],...,B[B.Length-1] are tested to make sure they are "zero".
member.returns: Array of length ColumnCount on success. null on error.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the matrix is column orthogonal.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the matrix is row orthonormal.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterStyle
member.summary: Type of Mesh Parameters used by the RhinoDoc for meshing objects

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterStyle.None
member.summary: No style

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange
member.summary: Defines how to pack render/meshes textures.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange.Unset
member.summary: This value is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange.UnpackedUnscaledNormalized
member.summary: Each face has a normalized texture range [0,1]x[0,1]. The normalized coordinate is calculated using the entire surface domain. For meshes of trimmed surfaces when the active area is a small subset of the entire surface, there will be large regions of unused texture space in [0,1]x[0,1]. When the 3d region being meshed is far from being square-ish, there will be a substantial amount of distortion mapping [0,1]x[0,1] texture space to the 3d mesh.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange.PackedScaledNormalized
member.summary: Each face is assigned a texture range that is a sub-rectangle of [0,1]x[0,1]. The sub-rectangles are mutually disjoint and packed into [0,1]x[0,1] in a way that minimizes distortion and maximizes the coverage of [0,1]x[0,1]. When the surface or surfaces being meshed are trimmed, this option takes into account only the region of the base surface the mesh covers and uses as much of [0,1]x[0,1] as possible. (default)

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density
member.summary: Density enumeration

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.UnsetDensity
member.summary: Indicates the SubD display mesh density has not be set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MinimumUserInterfaceDensity
member.summary: The minimum SubD display density that can be se in Rhino user interface is ExtraCoarseDensity (1).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumUserInterfaceDensity
member.summary: The maximum SubD display density that can be se in Rhino user interface is ExtraFineDensity (5).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MinimumAdaptiveDensity
member.summary: SubD display density values <= MinimumAdaptiveDensity will never be adaptively reduced. SubD display density values > MinimumAdaptiveDensity may be adaptively reduced to a value >= MinimumAdaptiveDensity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MinimumDensity
member.summary: Each SubD quad will generate 1 display mesh quads in a 1x1 grid. This density can only be used with SubDs where every face is a quad. User interface code never returns this density.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.ExtraCoarseDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 4 display mesh quads in a 2x2 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N display mesh quads. Adaptive reductions do not apply to this density. This is the minimum SubD display density.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.CoarseDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 16 display mesh quads in a 4x4 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N*4 display mesh quads. Adaptive reductions do not apply to this density.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MediumDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 64 display mesh quads in an 8x8 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N*8 display mesh quads. When a SubD has more than 8000 faces, adaptive MediumDensity is reduced to CoarseDensity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.FineDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 256 display mesh quads in a 16x16 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N*16 display mesh quads. When a SubD has more than 2000 faces, adaptive FineDensity is reduced to adaptive MediumDensity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 256 display mesh quads in a 16x16 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N*16 display mesh quads. When a SubD has more than 2000 faces, adaptive DefaultDensity is reduced to adaptive MediumDensity. This is the default value for creating mesh approximations of SubD surface. When treadted as an adaptive setting, it produces acceptable results for most SubDs.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.ExtraFineDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 1024 display mesh quads in a 32x32 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N*32 display mesh quads. When a SubD has more than 500 faces, adaptive ExtraFineDensity is reduced to adaptive FineDensity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity
member.summary: When interpreted as an absolute SubD display density, each SubD quad will generate 4096 display mesh quads in a 64x64 grid and each SubD N-gon will generate N*64 display mesh quads. SubDDisplayParameters.AdaptiveDensity() determines if the subd display density is treated adaptively or absolutely. This value creates ridiculously dense display meshes and should generally be avoided. No Rhino user interface will create this value.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.ClampDisplayDensity(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Limits display density to a value useful in user interface code.
member.returns: The clamped value.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.AdaptiveDisplayMeshQuadMaximum
member.summary: When the SubD display density is adaptive (default), AdaptiveMeshQuadMaximum specifies the approximate number of display mesh quads to permit before reducing the SubD display mesh density.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Empty
member.summary: Get an empty SubDDisplayParameters.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.ExtraCoarse
member.summary: Parameters for an extra course limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.ExtraCoarseDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Coarse
member.summary: Parameters for a course limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.CoarseDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Medium
member.summary: Parameters for a medium limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MediumDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Fine
member.summary: Parameters for a fine limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.FineDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.ExtraFine
member.summary: Parameters for an extra fine limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.ExtraFineDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.Default
member.summary: Parameters for the default limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.AbsoluteDisplayDensityFromSubDFaceCount(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the absolute SubD display density for SubD with subdFaceCount faces.
member.param: A value <= SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity. When in doubt, pass SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity.
member.returns: The absolute SubD display density is <= adaptiveSubDDisplayDensity and <= SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.AbsoluteDisplayDensityFromSubD(System.UInt32,Rhino.Geometry.SubD)
member.summary: Gets absolute SubD display density for subd.
member.param: A value <= SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity. When in doubt, pass SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity.
In the cases when the SubD in question is not available, like user interface code that applies in general and to unknown SubDs, pass SubD.Empty.
member.returns: The absolute SubD display density is <= adaptiveSubDDisplayDensity and <= SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.CreateFromDisplayDensity(System.UInt32)
member.summary: In most applications, the caller sets the mesh density and leaves the other parameters set to the default values.
member.param: A value <= SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity. When in doubt, pass SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity. Values < SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MinimumAdaptiveDensity are treated as SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MinimumAdaptiveDensity. All other invalid input values are treated as SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.CreateFromAbsoluteDisplayDensity(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use of absolute display density is strongly discouraged. SubDs can have a single face or millions of faces. Adaptive display meshing produces more desirable results in almost all cases.
member.param: A value <= SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MaximumDensity. When in doubt, pass SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity.
member.returns: The SubD display parameters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.CreateFromMeshDensity(System.Double)
member.summary: This function creates SubDDisplayParameters from a user interface "slider" like Rhino's simple mesh controls.
member.returns: A valid ON_SubDDisplayParameters with the specified subd display density.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.DisplayDensityIsAdaptive
member.summary: True if the SubD display density setting is adaptive and approximate display mesh quad count is capped at SubDDisplayParameters::AdaptiveDisplayMeshQuadMaximum.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.DisplayDensityIsAbsolute
member.summary: True if the SubD display density setting is absolute.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters.DisplayDensity(Rhino.Geometry.SubD)
member.summary: Gets the absolute display density to use when creating display meshes for SubD. When adaptive reduction is enabled, subd.Faces.Count is used to determine the appropriate display density.

member.summary:
Gets mesh creation parameters for coarse meshing.

member.summary: Gets mesh creation parameters to create the a render mesh when meshing speed is preferred over mesh quality.

member.summary:
Gets mesh creation parameters for smooth meshing.
This corresponds with the "Smooth and Slower" default in Rhino.

member.summary: Gets mesh creation parameters to create the a render mesh when mesh quality is preferred over meshing speed.

member.summary: Gets mesh creation parameters to create the default analysis mesh.

member.summary: Gets or sets how and if textures will be packed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.JaggedSeams
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the mesh is allowed to have jagged seams. When this flag is set to true, meshes on either side of a Brep Edge will not match up.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.RefineGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the sampling grid can be refined when certain tolerances are not met.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.DoublePrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the mesh should have double precision vertices in addition to the floats.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.SimplePlanes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not planar areas are allowed to be meshed in a simplified manner.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.ComputeCurvature
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not surface curvature data will be embedded in the mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.ClosedObjectPostProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to post process non-closed meshes that should be closed. If the Brep being meshed is closed, JaggedSeams = false, and ClosedObjectPostProcess = true, and the resulting mesh is not closed, then a post meshing process is applied to find and close gaps in the mesh. Typically the resulting mesh is not closed because the input Brep has a geometric flaw, like loops in trimming curve.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridMinCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of grid quads in the initial sampling grid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridMaxCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of grid quads in the initial sampling grid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed angle difference (in radians) for a single sampling quad. The angle pertains to the surface normals.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed aspect ratio of sampling quads.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridAmplification
member.summary: Gets or sets the grid amplification factor. Values lower than 1.0 will decrease the number of initial quads, values higher than 1.0 will increase the number of initial quads.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Tolerance

member.summary: Parameters for QuadRemesh method

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.TargetEdgeLength
member.summary: When TargetEdgeLength is greater than 0 TargetQuadCount will be re-computed with the target goal of an approximated edge length based on the area of the input mesh e.g TargetQuadCount = Input mesh Area * sqr(TargetEdgeLength) AdaptiveSize as well as AdaptiveQuadCount will also be ignored;

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.TargetQuadCount
member.summary: The number of quads to try to achieve in the final re-meshed object Note: This value is overridden if TargetEdgeLength > 0

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.AdaptiveSize
member.summary: Larger values results in for quad sizes that adjust to match input curvature. Smaller values results in more uniform quad sizes at the risk of less feature preservation. Range [0 - 100] Note: this value is ignored when TargetEdgeLength > 0

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.AdaptiveQuadCount
member.summary: Respect the original Target Quad Count value as much as possible. True returns more quads than TargetQuadCount depending on amount of high-curvature areas. Note: this value is ignored when TargetEdgeLength > 0

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.DetectHardEdges
member.summary: When enabled the hard edges in models will be retained.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.GuideCurveInfluence
member.summary: 0 = Approximate 1 = Interpolate Edge Ring 2 = Interpolate Edge Loop This value is ignored if Guide Curves are not supplied

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.PreserveMeshArrayEdgesMode
member.summary: 0=off, 1=On(Smart), 2=On(Strict) : Mesh array's created from Breps will have their brep face edge boundaries retained. Smart - Small or insignificant input faces are ignored. Strict - All input faces are factored in re-meshed result.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshParameters.SymmetryAxis
member.summary: Symmetry axis to use for symmetric re-meshing

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshSymmetryAxis
member.summary: Symmetrical meshing axis

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshSymmetryAxis.None
member.summary: No symmetric re-meshing

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshSymmetryAxis.X
member.summary: Symmetry across X axis

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshSymmetryAxis.Y
member.summary: Symmetry across Y axis

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.QuadRemeshSymmetryAxis.Z
member.summary: Symmetry across Z axis

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters
member.summary: Parameters for ShrinkWrap method

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters.TargetEdgeLength
member.summary: The desired target edge length in document units Smaller values equal more mesh resolution at the expense of larger mesh sizes

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters.Offset
member.summary: Distance to offset outward or inward

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters.SmoothingIterations
member.summary: Number of times to apply smoothing

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters.FillHolesInInputObjects
member.summary: Any input meshes will have "Fill Holes" applied to them before volume creation This value is ignored when input objects are Point Clouds

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters.PolygonOptimization
member.summary: 0 - 100 the percentage of optimization desired. Polygons will be reduced in areas of lower curvature Lower values result in better feature preservation at the cost of more polygons

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.ShrinkWrapParameters.InflateVerticesAndPoints
member.summary: Inflate mesh vertices, points and point clouds Mesh vertices will be inflated as though the mesh were a point cloud

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsClosed
member.summary: Returns true if every mesh "edge" has two or more faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsOriented
member.summary: Returns true if the mesh is manifold and every pair of faces that share an "edge" have compatible orientations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsSolid
member.summary: Returns true if the mesh is solid. A "solid" is a closed oriented manifold.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsManifold
member.summary: Returns true if every mesh "edge" has at most two faces.
member.returns: true if the mesh is manifold, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsManifold(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the mesh is manifold. A manifold mesh does not have any edge that borders more than two faces.
member.param: If true, the query treats coincident vertices as the same.
isOriented will be set to true if the mesh is a manifold and adjacent faces have compatible face normals.
hasBoundary will be set to true if the mesh is a manifold and there is at least one "edge" with no more than one adjacent face.
member.returns: true if every mesh "edge" has at most two adjacent faces.

member.summary:
Gets the object associated with this mesh.
This object stores vertex connectivity and the indices of vertices that were unified while computing the edge topology.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.TopologyEdges
member.summary:
Gets the object associated with this mesh.
This object stores edge connectivity.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Normals
member.summary: Gets access to the vertex normal collection in this mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Faces
member.summary: Gets access to the mesh face list.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Ngons
member.summary:
Gets access to the mesh ngon list.
Ngons represent groups of Faces (triangles + quads).
Faces are used to tessellate an Ngon internally.
When a triangle or quad is referenced in the Ngon list, it is no longer visualized and conceived as a single entity, but takes part of the Ngon.
If you need to get access to both Ngons and the faces that are not referenced by Ngons, that is, all polygons that are visible in the mesh, then use the helper method.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.FaceNormals
member.summary: Gets access to the face normal collection in this mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.TextureCoordinates
member.summary: Gets access to the vertex texture coordinate collection in this mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ComponentStates
member.summary: Gets access to the vertex hidden/visibility collection in this mesh. This is a runtime property and it is not saved in the 3dm file.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.SetSurfaceParametersFromTextureCoordinates
member.summary: If the mesh does not have surface evaluation parameters, has texture coordinates, and the surface parameters can be set in a way so the existing texture coordinates can be computed from the surface parameters, then this function sets the surface parameters. This is useful when meshes that have texture coordinates and do not have surface parameters want to set the surface parameters in a way so that the texture mapping of type TextureMappingType.SurfaceParameters will restore the texture coordinates.
member.returns: true - successful false - failure - no changes made to the mesh

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Note that even valid mesh faces could potentially be invalid in the context of a specific Mesh, if one or more of the corner indices exceeds the number of vertices on the mesh. If you want to perform a complete validity check, use IsValid(int) instead.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes upper bound indices into account.
member.param: Number of vertices in the mesh that this face is a part of.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes actual point locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to validate the face.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Repair(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Attempts to repair this mesh face by taking both face indexes and actual vertex locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to consider when repairing the face.
member.returns: true if the face was repaired, false if not.
member.remarks: This function assumes the face is invalid and attempts to repair unconditionally. It is only worthwhile to call Repair on faces where IsValid returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValidEx(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[]@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes actual point locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to validate the face.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.RepairEx(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[]@)
member.summary: Attempts to repair this mesh face by taking both face indexes and actual vertex locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to consider when repairing the face.
member.returns: true if the face was repaired, false if not.
member.remarks:
This function assumes the face is invalid and attempts to repair unconditionally. It is only worthwhile to call Repair on faces where IsValid returns false.
This function is the analog of UnsafeNativeMethods.ON_MeshFace_Repair done completely here to avoid copying the point array.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsTriangle
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a triangle. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C equals D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a triangle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsQuad
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a quad. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C does not equal D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets all the corners for this face as a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Flip

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.CompareTo(Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace)
member.summary:
Compares this with another and returns a value of 1, 0, or -1, referring to dictionary order.
Index evaluation priority is first A, then B, then C, then D.
member.param: The other to use in comparison.

returns.para: 0: if this is identical to other
-1: if this < other. Priority is for index of corner A first, then B, then C, then D.
+1: otherwise.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon
member.summary:
Represents a mesh ngon.
When retrieved from the Ngon property of a mesh, this contains faces that have edge valence strictly higher than 4.
When retrieving Ngons from , this might contain also triangles and quads.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.Create(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32})
member.summary: Constructs an ngon from lists of mesh vertex and face indexes.
member.param: A list of mesh vertex indexes that define the outer boundary of the ngon. The mesh vertex indexes must be in the correct order.
A list of mesh face indexes that define the interior of the ngon. The mesh face indexes may be in any order.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.Empty
member.summary: Gets an empty MeshNgon.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.DebuggerDisplayUtil
member.summary: Internal property that figures out the debugger display for mesh Faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.BoundaryVertexCount
member.summary: Get the number of vertices in this ngon. about length information.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.FaceCount
member.summary: Get the number of faces in this ngon.

members.member:
Get a mesh vertex index from the ngon's vertex index list.
A mesh vertex number between 0 and MeshNgon.VertexCount-1 that refers to a mesh vertex index in this ngon. A mesh vertex index. about length information.

Get the outer boundary mesh vertex list of the ngon.
Vertices are sorted counterclockwise with respect to the direction of the face, although the degree by which vertex normals will respect this might vary.
A list of mesh vertex indexes. about length information. 6.0

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation for this . This is to provide a meaningful visualization of this structure and is subject to change in newer releases.
member.returns: The string representation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon.CompareTo(Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon)
member.summary:
Compares this with otherNgon and returns a value of 1, 0, or -1.
Priority is for vertex count, then face count, then vertex index list values, then face index list values.
member.param: The other to use in comparison.

returns.para: 0: if this is identical to otherNgon
-1: if this < otherNgon.
+1: if this > otherNgon.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.KnotStyle
member.summary: Knot styles for NURBS curves and surfaces. If a knot vector meets the conditions of two styles, then the style with the lowest value is used.

member.summary: All internal knots have full multiplicity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.KnotStyle.ClampedEnd

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.KnotStyle.NonUniform

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateFromArc(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the arc. Note that the parameterization of NURBS curve does not match arc's transcendental parameterization.
member.returns: Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateFromCircle(Rhino.Geometry.Circle)
member.summary: Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the circle. Note that the parameterization of NURBS curve does not match circle's transcendental parameterization. Use GetRadianFromNurbFormParameter() and GetParameterFromRadian() to convert between the NURBS curve parameter and the transcendental parameter.
member.returns: Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateFromEllipse(Rhino.Geometry.Ellipse)
member.summary:
Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the ellipse.
Note that the parameterization of the NURBS curve does not match with the transcendental parameterization of the ellipsis.
member.returns: A NURBS curve representation of this ellipse or null if no such representation could be made.

tolerance to use when comparing control points.

member.summary: Constructs a new NURBS curve with knot and CV memory allocated.

member.summary: Gets the order of the curve. Order = Degree + 1.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the curve is rational. Rational curves have control-points with custom weights.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.Knots
member.summary: Gets access to the knots (or "knot vector") of this NURBS curve.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.Points
member.summary: Gets access to the control points of this NURBS curve.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.IncreaseDegree(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increase the degree of this curve.
member.param: The desired degree. Degrees should be number between and including 1 and 11.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.HasBezierSpans
member.summary: Returns true if the NURBS curve has Bezier spans (all distinct knots have multiplicity = degree)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.MakePiecewiseBezier(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clamps ends and adds knots so the NURBS curve has Bezier spans (all distinct knots have multiplicity = degree).
member.param: If true and the first or last weight is not one, then the first and last spans are re-parameterized so that the end weights are one.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.Reparameterize(System.Double)
member.summary: Use a linear fractional transformation to re-parameterize the NURBS curve. This does not change the curve's domain.
member.param: re-parameterization constant (generally speaking, c should be > 0). The control points and knots are adjusted so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)), where lambda(t) = c*t/( (c-1)*t + 1 ). Note that lambda(0) = 0, lambda(1) = 1, lambda'(t) > 0, lambda'(0) = c and lambda'(1) = 1/c.
member.returns: true if successful.
member.remarks: The CV and knot values are values are changed so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)).

member.summary: Appends a NURBS curve to this curve.
