member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.CommonComponentTable`1.FindId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Uses the guid to find a model component. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored in the .Id property. In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits its guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/opening operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of model component to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.CommonComponentTable`1.__FindIndexInternal(System.Int32)
member.summary: This is internal so that we can choose when to deliver the functionality for each table. Object, history and instance tables have no indices.

member.param: NameHash of model component to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.ManifestTable
member.summary: Maintains an index to every model component that is in the 3dm file. This is the "more comprehensive" table that contains all objects in all other tables.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.ManifestTable.Parent
member.summary: Returns the parent object. This is the RhinoDoc, or the File3md file.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.ManifestTable.FindId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Uses the guid to find a model component. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored in the .Id property. In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits its guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/opening operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of model component to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.ManifestTable.FindId(System.Guid,Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponentType)
member.summary: Uses the guid to find a model component. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored in the .Id property. In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits its guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/opening operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of model component to search for.
The type to be searched. If this is then all types are searched.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement
member.summary: Represents the displacement attached to file3dm object attributes.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.On
member.summary: Specifies whether the displacement feature is enabled or not.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.TextureId
member.summary: Specifies which texture is used for computing the displacement amount.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.MappingChannel
member.summary: Specifies which texture mapping channel is used for the displacement texture.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.BlackPoint
member.summary: Specifies the amount of displacement for the black color in the texture.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.WhitePoint
member.summary: Specifies the amount of displacement for the white color in the texture.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.InitialQuality
member.summary: Specifies how densely the object is initially subdivided. The lower the value, the higher the resolution of the displaced mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.FinalMaxFacesOn
member.summary: Specifies whether to perform a mesh reduction as a post process to simplify the result of displacement.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.FinalMaxFaces
member.summary: Specifies how many faces the reduction post process should target.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.FairingOn
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to perform a fairing step. Fairing straightens rough feature edges.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.Fairing
member.summary: Specifies the number of steps for the fairing process. Fairing straightens rough feature edges.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.PostWeldAngle
member.summary: Specifies the maximum angle between face normals of adjacent faces that will get welded together.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.MeshMemoryLimit
member.summary: Specifies in megabytes how much memory can be allocated for use by the displacement mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.RefineSteps
member.summary: Specifies the number of refinement passes

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.RefineSensitivity
member.summary: Specifies how sensitive the divider for contrasts is on the displacement texture. Specify 1 to split all mesh edges on each refine step. Specify 0.99 to make even slight contrasts on the displacement texture cause edges to be split. Specifying 0.01 only splits edges where heavy contrast exists.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.SweepResolutionFormulas
member.summary: Formula to use to calculate sweep resolution from initial quality.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.SweepResolutionFormulas.Default
member.summary: Default formula.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.SweepResolutionFormulas.AbsoluteToleranceDependent
member.summary: Formula used in Rhino 5. Dependent on absolute tolerance.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.SweepResolutionFormula
member.summary: Specifies which formula is used to calculate sweep resolution from initial quality.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.GetSubItemFaceIndexes
member.summary: Gets all the sub-items on the displacement. Sub-items can exist to override the top-level parameters for polysurface/SubD faces. Sub-items are identified by the face index that they apply to. An array of the face indexes of each sub-item on the displacement.

member.summary: Adds a new sub-item to the displacement. face_index is the index of the face on the polysurface/SubD. on is the override for File3dmDisplacement.On. texture is the override for File3dmDisplacement.TextureId. mapping_channel is the override for File3dmDisplacement.MappingChannel. black_point is the override for File3dmDisplacement.BlackPoint. white_point is the override for File3dmDisplacement.WhitePoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmDisplacement.DeleteSubItem(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.TextLog.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.TextLog.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.TextLog.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.DimensionStyle.Field.LengthFactor
member.summary: LengthFactor is a rarely used. It applies when a model is being drawn to a scale and the dimension length values should be reverse scaled. For example, if a model is drawn at 1/4 scale, a line 5 units long indicates the real world line is 20 units long. In this case setting LengthFactor to 4 would cause a linear dimension applied to that line to display a value of 20.

members.member:
Normally, a DimensionStyle is neither a Child nor a Parent. Setting the value of DimensionStyle.ParentId to the Id of another DimensionStyle makes that style the Parent of this style. Fields in a DimensionStyle can get their values from the Child style or the Parent style. If a field is marked overridden in the Child style, the value of that field comes from the Parent. Typically, when an individual field is overridden for a specific annotation object, a Child DimensionStyle is made with that field marked as an overridden field (SetFieldOverride()) and that DimensionStyle is made the Child of the annotation object's DimensionStyle. Then the DimensionStyleId of the annotation object is set to the Id of the Child style
True if the field corresponding to field_id is overridden in this AnnotationStyle False if the field is not overridden
6.0

member.summary: Set a field as overridden

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between grid lines.

member.summary: when "grid snap" is enabled, the distance between snap points. Typically this is the same distance as grid spacing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of grid lines in each direction.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane.ThickLineFrequency
member.summary:
Gets or sets the recurrence of a wider line on the grid.
0: No lines are thick, all are drawn thin.
1: All lines are thick.
2: Every other line is thick.
3: One line in three lines is thick (and two are thin).
4: ...

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane.DepthBuffered
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the grid is drawn on top of geometry.
false=grid is always drawn behind 3d geometry
true=grid is drawn at its depth as a 3d plane and grid lines obscure things behind the grid.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewInfo.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetModelCompass
member.summary: Returns a plane in model coordinates whose X axis points East, Y axis points North and Z axis points Up. The origin is set to ModelBasepoint.
member.returns: A plane value. This might be invalid on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetModelToEarthTransform(Rhino.UnitSystem)
member.summary: Gets a transformation from model coordinates to earth coordinates. This transformation assumes the model is small enough that the curvature of the earth can be ignored.
member.returns: Transform on success. Invalid Transform on error.
member.remarks:
If M is a point in model coordinates and E = model_to_earth*M, then E.x = latitude in decimal degrees E.y = longitude in decimal degrees E.z = elevation in meters above mean sea level Because the earth is not flat, there is a small amount of error when using a linear transformation to calculate oblate spherical coordinates. This error is small. If the distance from P to M is d meters, then the approximation error is latitude error <= longitude error <= elevation error <= 6379000*((1 + (d/6356000)^2)-1) meters
In particular, if every point in the model is within 1000 meters of the m_model_basepoint, then the maximum approximation errors are latitude error <= longitude error <= elevation error <= 8 centimeters.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetEarthAnchorPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Returns the earth anchor plane
member.returns: A plane value.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.NamePathSeparator
member.summary: Returns the string "::". This is the string Rhino uses in layer full path names to separate the names of individual layers.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ModelSerialNumber
member.summary: A value identifying the model that manages this component.
member.remarks: If the component is being managed by a model, this value identifies the model. In Rhino, this value is the document runtime serial number. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ReferenceModelSerialNumber
member.summary: When a component is in a model for reference, this value identifies the reference model.
member.remarks: Reference components are not saved in .3dm archives. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.InstanceDefinitionModelSerialNumber
member.summary: When a component is in a model as part of the information required for a linked instance definition, this value identifies the linked instance definition reference model.
member.remarks: Reference components are not saved in .3dm archives. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ComponentType
member.summary: Gets the for this object. Useful in switch statements.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of the model component type, and then its name and index.
member.remarks: This is provided as a visual aid. Do not rely on this for serialization.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ModelComponentTypeRequiresUniqueName(Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponentType)
member.summary: Informs the developer if a particular model component type will require uniqueness within a document. This is currently true with render materials and model geometry; false otherwise.
member.returns: true with render materials and model geometry; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ModelComponentTypeIgnoresCase(Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponentType)
member.summary: Informs the developer if a particular model component type will require case-ignoring searching within a document. This is currently true with groups; false otherwise.
member.param: True if the component ignores case.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ModelComponentTypeIncludesParent(Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponentType)
member.summary: Informs the developer if a particular model component type will include the hash of the parent.
member.param: True if the component includes parent hash.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.FileName
member.summary:
Gets or sets a file name that is used by this texture.
NOTE: We are moving away from string-based FileName, and suggest the usage of the new FileReference class.
Also, this filename may well not be a path that makes sense on a user's computer because it was a path initially set on a different user's computer. If you want to get a workable path for this user, use the BitmapTable.Find function using this property.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.FileReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a copy of the file reference that is used by this texture. After the get or the set method complete, you own the copy you received or passed in, and can Dispose() of it.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.MagFilter

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.GetAlphaBlendValues(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
If the TextureCombineMode is Blend, then the blending function for alpha is determined by
new alpha = constant + a0*(current alpha) + a1*(texture alpha) + a2*min(current alpha,texture alpha) + a3*max(current alpha,texture alpha)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.SetAlphaBlendValues(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
If the TextureCombineMode is Blend, then the blending function for alpha is determined by
new alpha = constant + a0*(current alpha) + a1*(texture alpha) + a2*min(current alpha,texture alpha) + a3*max(current alpha,texture alpha)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.SetRGBBlendValues(System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
If the TextureCombineMode is Blend, then the blending function for RGB is determined by
new rgb = colorcolor + a0[0]*(current RGB) + a1[1]*(texture RGB) + a2[2]*min(current RGB,texture RGB) + a3[3]*max(current RGB,texture RGB)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Description
member.summary: Descriptive name of the user data.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.ShouldWrite
member.summary: If you want to save this user data in a 3dm file, override ShouldWrite and return true. If you do support serialization, you must also override the Read and Write functions.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Write(Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter)
member.summary: Writes the content of this data to a stream archive.
member.returns: true if the data was successfully written. The default implementation always returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Read(Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader)
member.summary: Reads the content of this data from a stream archive.
member.returns: true if the data was successfully written. The default implementation always returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.OnTransform(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Is called when the object associated with this data is transformed. If you override this function, make sure to call the base class if you want the stored Transform to be updated.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.OnGetChangeSerialNumber
member.summary:
Is called when DataCRC on a user data is called that derives from Custom.UserData.
Note that this doesn't really implement a DataCRC, but rather it'll return the current change serial number if the implementing class supports that, or 0 by default.
Currently ArchivableDictionary supports this where each SetItem call increments the change serial number of the instance.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.OnDuplicate(Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData)
member.summary: Is called when the object is being duplicated.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.OnGetChangeSerialNumber(System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Get the current change serial number, if supported by the implement class. 0 by defauult if a UD is found, otherwise just the currentRemainder as given.
Note that this builds on the DataCRC method to reuse it in a way for which it wasn't designed. Instead an increasing change serial number is returned. Increases happen on SetItem in ArchivableDictionary at least.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Copy(Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject,Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject)
member.summary: Expert user tool that copies user data that has a positive CopyCount from the source object to a destination object. Generally speaking you don't need to use Copy(). Simply rely on things like the copy constructors to do the right thing.
member.param: A source object for the data.
A destination object for the data.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.MoveUserDataFrom(Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject)
member.summary: Moves the user data from objectWithUserData to a temporary data storage identified by the return Guid. When MoveUserDataFrom returns, the objectWithUserData will not have any user data.
member.returns: Guid identifier for storage of UserData that is held in a temporary list by this class. This function should be used in conjunction with MoveUserDataTo to transfer the user data to a different object. Returns Guid.Empty if there was no user data to transfer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.MoveUserDataTo(Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the user data.
See for more information.
member.param: If the data should be appended or replaced.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Transform
member.summary: Updated if user data is attached to a piece of geometry that is transformed and the virtual OnTransform() is not overridden. If you override OnTransform() and want Transform to be updated, then call the base class OnTransform() in your override. The default constructor sets Transform to the identity.

member.summary: Get or set whether this projection is perspective.

member.summary: Get or set whether this projection is parallel.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this projection is a two-point perspective.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToParallelProjection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not be changed. If the current projection is parallel and symmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not changed. If the current projection is perspective and symmetricFrustum, IsFrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric, and IsFrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be preserved.
true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToTwoPointPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Changes projections of valid viewports to a two point perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location and direction so the resulting views are similar. If the current projection is perspective and IsFrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric is true and IsFrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric is false, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be preserved.
The locked up direction. Pass Vector3d.Zero if you want to use the world axis direction that is closest to the current up direction. Pass CameraY() if you want to preserve the current up direction.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToSymmetricFrustum(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: If needed, adjusts the current frustum so it has the specified symmetries and adjust the camera location so the target plane remains visible.
member.param: If true, the frustum will be adjusted so left = -right.
If true, the frustum will be adjusted so top = -bottom.

If projection is not perspective or target_distance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then this parameter is ignored. If the projection is perspective and targetDistance is not RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then it must be > 0.0 and it is used to determine which plane in the old frustum will appear unchanged in the new frustum.
member.returns: Returns true if the viewport has now a frustum with the specified symmetries.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetPointDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the clipping distance of a point. This function ignores the current value of the viewport's near and far settings. If the viewport is a perspective projection, then it intersects the semi infinite frustum volume with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the intersection. If the viewport is a parallel projection, it intersects the infinite view region with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the projection.
member.returns: true if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the bounding box does not intersect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetBoundingBoxDepth(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets near and far clipping distances of a bounding box. This function ignores the current value of the viewport's near and far settings. If the viewport is a perspective projection, the it intersects the semi infinite frustum volume with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the intersection. If the viewport is a parallel projection, it intersects the infinite view region with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the projection.
member.param: Near distance of the box. This value can be zero or negative when the camera location is inside box.
Far distance of the box. This value can be equal to near_dist, zero or negative when the camera location is in front of the bounding box.
member.returns: true if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the bounding box does not intersect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetSphereDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets near and far clipping distances of a bounding sphere.
member.param: Near distance of the sphere (can be < 0)
Far distance of the sphere (can be equal to near_dist)
member.returns: true if the sphere intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the sphere does not intersect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.SetFrustumNearFar(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets near and far clipping distance subject to constraints.
member.param: If min_near_dist <= 0.0, it is ignored. If min_near_dist > 0 and near_dist < min_near_dist, then the frustum's near_dist will be increased to min_near_dist.

If min_near_over_far <= 0.0, it is ignored. If near_dist < far_dist*min_near_over_far, then near_dist is increased and/or far_dist is decreased so that near_dist = far_dist*min_near_over_far. If near_dist < target_dist < far_dist, then near_dist near_dist is increased and far_dist is decreased so that projection precision will be good at target_dist. Otherwise, near_dist is simply set to far_dist*min_near_over_far.
If target_dist <= 0.0, it is ignored. If target_dist > 0, it is used as described in the description of the min_near_over_far parameter.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumNearPlane
member.summary: Gets near clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the near clipping plane. The plane's normal points out of the frustum towards the camera location.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumFarPlane
member.summary: Gets far clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the far clipping plane. The plane's normal points into the frustum towards the camera location.

member.summary: Gets the frustum left plane that separates visible from off-screen.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumRightPlane
member.summary: Gets the frustum right plane that separates visible from off-screen.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumTopPlane
member.summary: Gets the frustum top plane that separates visible from off-screen.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetFarPlaneCorners

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.Extents(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary:
Extends this viewport view to include a bounding box.
Use Extents() as a quick way to set a viewport to so that bounding volume is inside of a viewports frustum. The view angle is used to determine the position of the camera.
member.param: 1/2 smallest subtended view angle in radians.
A bounding box in 3d world coordinates.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.Extents(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere)
member.summary:
Extends this viewport view to include a sphere.
Use Extents() as a quick way to set a viewport to so that bounding volume is inside of a viewports frustum. The view angle is used to determine the position of the camera.
member.param: 1/2 smallest subtended view angle in radians.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyCamera(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: DollyCamera() does not update the frustum's clipping planes. To update the frustum's clipping planes call DollyFrustum(d) with d = dollyVector o cameraFrameZ. To convert screen locations into a dolly vector, use GetDollyCameraVector(). Does not update frustum. To update frustum use DollyFrustum(d) with d = dollyVector o cameraFrameZ.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetDollyCameraVector(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a world coordinate dolly vector that can be passed to DollyCamera().
member.param: Distance of projection plane from camera. When in doubt, use 0.5*(frus_near+frus_far).
member.returns: The world coordinate dolly vector.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetDollyCameraVector(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a world coordinate dolly vector that can be passed to DollyCamera().
member.param: Distance of projection plane from camera. When in doubt, use 0.5*(frus_near+frus_far).
member.returns: The world coordinate dolly vector.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyFrustum(System.Double)
member.summary: Moves the frustum clipping planes.

member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyExtents(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase},System.Double)
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.param: If border > 1.0, then the frustum in enlarged by this factor to provide a border around the view. 1.1 works well for parallel projections; 0.0 is suggested for perspective projections.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyExtents(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double)
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.param: If border > 1.0, then the frustum in enlarged by this factor to provide a border around the view. 1.1 works well for parallel projections; 0.0 is suggested for perspective projections.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ViewScale
member.summary: Applies scaling factors to parallel projection clipping coordinates by setting the m_clip_mod transformation. If you want to compress the view projection across the viewing plane, then set x = 0.5, y = 1.0, and z = 1.0.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.SetViewScale(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set scaling applied for this viewport projection. For reflected projections, call with values 1,1,-1

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetViewScale
member.summary: Get scaling applied to this viewport projection. Reflected ceiling projections will return the values 1,1,-1

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumCenterPoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Return a point on the central axis of the view frustum. This point is a good choice for a general purpose target point.
member.param: If targetDistance > 0.0, then the distance from the returned point to the camera plane will be targetDistance. Note that if the frustum is not symmetric, the distance from the returned point to the camera location will be larger than targetDistance. If targetDistance == ON_UNSET_VALUE and the frustum is valid with near > 0.0, then 0.5*(near + far) will be used as the targetDistance.
member.returns: A point on the frustum's central axis. If the viewport or input is not valid, then ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint is returned.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.TargetPoint
member.summary: The current value of the target point. This point does not play a role in the view projection calculations. It can be used as a fixed point when changing the camera so the visible regions of the before and after frustums both contain the region of interest. The default constructor sets this point on ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint. You must explicitly call one SetTargetPoint() functions to set the target point.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.TargetDistance(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the distance from the target point to the camera plane. Note that if the frustum is not symmetric, then this distance is shorter than the distance from the target to the camera location.
member.param: If bUseFrustumCenterFallback is false and the target point is not valid, then ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned. If bUseFrustumCenterFallback is true and the frustum is valid and current target point is not valid or is behind the camera, then 0.5*(near + far) is returned.
member.returns: Shortest signed distance from camera plane to target point. If the target point is on the visible side of the camera, a positive value is returned. ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned when the input of view is not valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.PerspectiveMinNearOverFar
member.summary: Expert user function to control the minimum ratio of near/far when perspective projections are begin used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.PerspectiveMinNearDist
member.summary: Expert user function to control the minimum value of near when perspective projections are being used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.Id

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchLine
member.summary: Hatch lines are used by hatch pattern to specify the dashes and offset patterns of the lines.
member.remarks: Each line has the following information: Angle is the direction of the line counter-clockwise from the x-axis. The first line origin is at the base point. Each line repetition is offset from the previous line. Offset.X is parallel to the line and Offset.Y is perpendicular to the line. The base and offset values are rotated by the line's angle to produce a location in the hatch pattern's coordinate system. There can be gaps and dashes specified for drawing the line. If there are no dashes, the line is solid. Negative length dashes are gaps. Positive length dashes are drawn as line segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchLine.#ctor
member.summary: Construts a new hatch line.

member.summary: Verifies a hatch line is valid.

member.summary: Gets and sets the angle, in radians, of the hatch line. The angle is measured counter-clockwise from the x-axis.

member.summary: Get and sets this line's 2d base point.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchLine.Offset
member.summary: Get and sets this line's 2d offset for line repetitions. Offset.X is shift parallel to line. Offset.Y is spacing perpendicular to line.

member.summary: Gets the number of dashes + gaps in this line.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType
member.summary: The possible relationships between the instance definition geometry and the archive containing the original definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static
member.summary: The Rhino user interface uses the term "Embedded" for Static update types. This instance definition is never updated. If m_source_archive is set, it records the origin of the instance definition geometry, but m_source_archive is never used to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Embedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive and is embedded. If the source archive changes, the user is asked if they want to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive and is embedded. If the source archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If the soruce archive is not available, the instance definition is still valid.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive and is not embedded. If the source archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If the source archive is not available, the instance definition is not valid.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionLayerStyle
member.summary: InstanceDefinition.LayerStyle specifies how model components (layers, materials, dimension styles, etc.) from linked instance definition files appear in the active model.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionLayerStyle.None
member.summary: This is the only valid layer style when the instance definition type is InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static or InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded. This style is not valid when the instance definition type is InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionLayerStyle.Active
member.summary: Model components (layers, materials, dimension styles, etc.) from linked instance definition files are embedded as ordinary components in the active model. This layer style may be used when the instance definition type is InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionLayerStyle.Reference
member.summary: Layers from the linked instance definition are reference components in the model. This is the default layer style when the instance definition type is InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked. This layer style may be used when the instance definition type is is InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus
member.summary: The archive file of a linked instance definition can have the following possible states. Use InstanceObject.ArchiveFileStatus to query a instance definition's archive file status.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.NotALinkedInstanceDefinition
member.summary: The instance definition is not a linked instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileNotReadable
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is not readable.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileNotFound
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file cannot be found.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsUpToDate
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is up-to-date.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsNewer
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is newer.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsOlder
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is older.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsDifferent
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is different.

member.summary: Gets the per viewport visibility of this layer.

member.summary: Controls layer visibility in specific viewports.
member.param: If not Guid.Empty, then the setting applies only to the viewport with the specified id. If Guid.Empty, then the setting applies to all viewports with per viewport layer settings.
true to make layer visible, false to make layer invisible.

member.summary: Remove any per viewport visibility setting so the layer's overall setting will be used for all viewports.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.PerViewportPersistentVisibility(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the per layer persistent visibility. The persistent viability setting is used for layers whose visibility can be changed by a parent layer. In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.returns: Return true if this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on in the specified viewport. Returns false if this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on(after being off), then this layer will continue to be off in the specified viewport.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.SetPerViewportPersistentVisibility(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the per layer persistent visibility. The persistent viability setting is used for layers whose visibility can be changed by a parent layer. In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.param: If not Guid.Empty, then the setting applies only to the viewport with the specified id. If Guid.Empty, then the setting applies to all viewports with per viewport layer settings.

If true, this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on in the specified viewport. If false, this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on (after being off), then this layer will continue to be off in the specified viewport.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.UnsetPerViewportPersistentVisibility(System.Guid)
member.summary: Remove any per viewport persistent visibility setting so the layer's overall setting will be used for all viewports.
member.param: If not Guid.Empty, then the setting for this viewport will be deleted. If Guid.Empty, the all per viewport visibility settings will be removed.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.IsLocked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the locked state of this layer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.GetPersistentVisibility
member.summary: The global persistent visibility setting is used for layers whose visibility can be changed by a "parent" object. A common case is when a layer is a child layer (ParentId is not nil). In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.remarks:
Returns true if this layer's visibility is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on. Returns false if this layer's visibility is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on (after being off), then this layer will continue to be off.
When the persistent viability is not explicitly set, this property returns the current value of IsVisible

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.SetPersistentVisibility(System.Boolean)

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.MaterialRefs
member.summary:
If you are developing a high quality plug-in renderer, and a user is assigning a custom render material to this object, then add rendering material information to the MaterialRefs dictionary.
Note to developers: As soon as the MaterialRefs dictionary contains items rendering material queries slow down. Do not populate the MaterialRefs dictionary when setting the MaterialIndex will take care of your needs.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Mode
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LinetypeSource
member.summary: The Linetype used to display an object is specified in one of two ways. If LinetypeSource is ON::linetype_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::Linetype() is used. If LinetypeSource is ON::linetype_from_object, then value of m_linetype is used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ColorSource
member.summary: The color used to display an object is specified in one of three ways. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::Color() is used. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_object, then value of m_color is used. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_material, then the diffuse color of the object's render material is used. See ON_3dmObjectAttributes::MaterialSource() to determine where to get the definition of the object's render material.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotColorSource
member.summary: The color used to plot an object on paper is specified in one of three ways. If PlotColorSource is ON::plot_color_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::PlotColor() is used. If PlotColorSource is ON::plot_color_from_object, then value of PlotColor() is used.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.RemoveDisplayModeOverride
member.summary: By default, objects are drawn using the display mode of the viewport that the object is being drawn in. Setting a specific display mode, instructs Rhino to always use that display mode, regardless of the viewport's mode. This function resets an object to use the viewport's display mode for all viewports.

member.summary: By default, objects are drawn using the display mode of the viewport that the object is being drawn in. Setting a specific display mode, instructs Rhino to always use that display mode, regardless of the viewport's mode. This function resets an object to use the viewport's display mode.
member.param: viewport that display mode overrides should be cleared from.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.CustomMeshingParameters
member.summary: Returns or sets the per-object render meshing parameters, which controls the object's render mesh density. If this property is null, then the object uses the document's render meshing parameters. To remove the per-object render meshing parameters, set this property to null.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectId
member.summary:
Every object has a Guid (globally unique identifier, also known as UUID, or universally unique identifier). The default value is Guid.Empty.
When an object is added to a model, the value is checked. If the value is Guid.Empty, a new Guid is created. If the value is not null but it is already used by another object in the model, a new Guid is created. If the value is not Guid.Empty and it is not used by another object in the model, then that value persists. When an object is updated, by a move for example, the value of ObjectId persists.
This value is the same as the one returned by object.Id.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets an object optional text name.
More than one object in a model can have the same name and some objects may have no name.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Url
member.summary: Objects may have an URL. There are no restrictions on what value this URL may have. As an example, if the object came from a commercial part library, the URL might point to the definition of that part.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LayerIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets an associated layer index.
Layer definitions in an OpenNURBS model are stored in a layer table. The layer table is conceptually an array of ON_Layer classes. Every OpenNURBS object in a model is on some layer. The object's layer is specified by zero based indices into the ON_Layer array.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LinetypeIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the linetype index.
Linetype definitions in an OpenNURBS model are stored in a linetype table. The linetype table is conceptually an array of ON_Linetype classes. Every OpenNURBS object in a model references some linetype. The object's linetype is specified by zero based indices into the ON_Linetype array.
Index 0 is reserved for continuous linetype (no pattern).

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the material index.
If you want something simple and fast, set the index of the rendering material.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialSource
member.summary: Determines if the simple material should come from the object or from it's layer. High quality rendering plug-ins should use m_rendering_attributes.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Decals
member.summary: Gets all object decals associated with this object.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.OCSMappingChannelId
member.summary: The mapping channel id to use when calling MappingChannel to retrieve the OCS mapping if there is one.
member.returns: The mapping channel id to use when calling MappingChannel to retrieve the OCS mapping if there is one.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectFrameFlags.Standard
member.summary: Never returns unset plane. Will always calculate the plane even if nothing is stored.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectFrameFlags.IncludeScaleTransforms
member.summary: By default, the plane is orientation and rotation only. But scale transforms are stored if you need them.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectFrameFlags.ReturnUnset
member.summary: The object frame may be stored unset by default. If this is the case, and you want to know if it really is unset, this will tell you.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.File3dmMeshModifiers
member.summary: Get an object that provides access to mesh modifiers when the attributes is for a File3dmObject.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialRefs
member.summary:
If you are developing a high quality plug-in renderer, and a user is assigning a custom render material to this object, then add rendering material information to the MaterialRefs dictionary.
Note to developers: As soon as the MaterialRefs dictionary contains items rendering material queries slow down. Do not populate the MaterialRefs dictionary when setting the MaterialIndex will take care of your needs.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectColor
member.summary: If ON::color_from_object == ColorSource, then color is the object's display color.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotColor
member.summary: If plot_color_from_object == PlotColorSource, then PlotColor is the object's plotting color.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.HasMapping
member.summary: A mapping from any plug-in source is associated with these attributes Need to do this here to respond correctly to ModifyObjectAttributes event

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.DisplayOrder
member.summary:
Display order used to force objects to be drawn on top or behind each other. Larger numbers draw on top of smaller numbers.
0 = draw object in standard depth buffered order
<0 = draw object behind "normal" draw order objects
>0 = draw object on top of "normal" draw order objects

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotWeight
member.summary: Plot weight in millimeters. =0.0 means use the default width <0.0 means don't plot (visible for screen display, but does not show on plot)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectDecoration
member.summary: Used to indicate an object has a decoration (like an arrowhead on a curve)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.WireDensity
member.summary: When a surface object is displayed in wireframe, this controls how many isoparametric wires are used. value number of isoparametric wires -1 boundary wires (off) 0 boundary and knot wires 1 boundary and knot wires and, if there are no interior knots, a single interior wire. N>=2 boundary and knot wires and (N+1) interior wires.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ViewportId
member.summary: If ViewportId is nil, the object is active in all viewports. If ViewportId is not nil, then this object is only active in a specific view. This field is primarily used to assign page space objects to a specific page, but it can also be used to restrict model space to a specific view.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Space
member.summary: Starting with V4, objects can be in either model space or page space. If an object is in page space, then ViewportId is not nil and identifies the page it is on.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.GroupCount

member.name: T:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment identifies a runtime environment (operating system). This value is saved in binary archives so appropriate adjustments to resources provided by runtime environments, like fonts, can be made when an archive created in one runtime environment is used in another.

member.name: F:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment.Unset
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment::Unset indicates no runtime is set.

member.name: F:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment.None
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment::None indicates no runtime. This is a different condition from ON::Runtime::Unset.

member.name: F:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment.Windows
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment::Windows indicates some version of Microsoft Windows.

member.name: F:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment.Apple
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment::Apple indicates some version of Apple OS X or iOS.

member.name: F:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment.Android
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment::Android indicates some version of Google Android.

member.name: F:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment.Linux
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment::Linux indicates some version of Linux.

member.name: F:Rhino.UnitSystem.None
member.summary: ON::LengthUnitSystem::None indicates no length unit system. The scale factor when converting between a specified unit system and None is always 1.0. member.name: F:Rhino.UnitSystem.NauticalMiles
member.summary: 1 nautical mile = 1852 meters Approximately 1 minute of arc on a terrestrial great circle. Reference: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nautical_mile

member.name: F:Rhino.UnitSystem.AstronomicalUnits
member.summary: 1 astronomical unit = 1.4959787e+11 meters An astronomical unit (au) is the mean distance from the center of the earth to the center of the sun. References: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronomical_unit (1.4959787e+11 meters) http://units.nist.gov/Pubs/SP811/appenB9.htm (1.495979e+11 meters)

member.name: F:Rhino.UnitSystem.LightYears
member.summary: 1 light year = 9.4607304725808e+15 meters A light year is the distance light travels in one Julian year. The speed of light is exactly 299792458 meters/second. A Julian year is exactly 365.25 * 86400 seconds and is approximately the time it takes for one earth orbit. References: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_year (9.4607304725808e+15 meters) http://units.nist.gov/Pubs/SP811/appenB9.htm (9.46073e+15 meters)

member.name: F:Rhino.UnitSystem.Parsecs
member.summary: 1 parsec = 3.08567758e+16 meters References: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parsec (3.08567758e+16 meters) http://units.nist.gov/Pubs/SP811/appenB9.htm (3.085678e+16)

member.name: M:Rhino.Runtime.HostUtils.InPlaceConstCast(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU ARE CERTAIN ABOUT THE IMPLICATIONS.
This is an expert user function which should not be needed in most cases. This function is similar to a const_cast in C++ to allow an object to be made temporarily modifiable without causing RhinoCommon to convert the class from const to non-const by creating a duplicate.
You must call this function with a true parameter, make your modifications, and then restore the const flag by calling this function again with a false parameter. If you have any questions, please contact McNeel developer support before using!

member.name: M:Rhino.Runtime.InteropWrappers.SimpleArrayPoint2d.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.StringParser.ParseLengthExpession(System.String,Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings,Rhino.UnitSystem,System.Double@)
member.summary: Parse a string for a length value. Expression can include complex expressions Simplest version of Length parsing
member.param: [In] Determines what input will be parsed
[In] Output value is in this unit system
member.returns: Count of characters parsed or 0 for failure

members.member:
Parse a string for a length value. Expression can include complex expressions Most complex version of length parsing
[In] The string to parse
[In] Offset position in string to start parsing
[In] Maximum length of string to parse. -1 means parse to a terminating character or end of string
[In] Determines what input will be parsed If trig functions are included in the expression, the angle unit system must be set correctly
[In] Output value is returned in this unit system
[Out] The length value result
[Out] Describes the results of the parse operation
[Out] If a unit system name was found in the string, it is returned here. The output value is in the unit system specified in output_unit_system
Returns the count of characters that were parsed or 0 if the operation was unsuccessful
6.0

member.summary: Parse a string expression to get a number
member.param: Maximum number of characters to parse
Determines what input will be parsed
Reports the results of the parse operation
The number result of the parse operation
member.returns: Count of characters in expression parsed if ParseNumber() returns 0, parse was unsuccessful

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings
member.summary: Parameters for parsing strings

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.DefaultParseSettings
member.summary: - The default settings parse just about everything in a reasonable way. - Any angle values with unspecified units will be treated as radians. Angles without units can be encountered while parsing formulas, lengths and points and need to be thoughtfully considered in most parsing situations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsRadians
member.summary: - The default settings parse just about everything in a reasonable way. - Any angle values with unspecified units will be treated as radians.Angles without units can be encountered while parsing formulas, lengths and points and need to be thoughtfully considered in most parsing situations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsDegrees
member.summary: - The default settings parse just about everything in a reasonable way. - Any angle values with unspecified units will be treated as degrees.Angles without units can be encountered while parsing formulas, lengths and points and need to be thoughtfully considered in most parsing situations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsIntegerNumber
member.summary: - The integer settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parses one or more digits.Parsing stops after the last digit.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsRationalNumber
member.summary: - The rational number settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parse one or more digits.If a rational number fraction bar follows the last digit in the numerator, then it is parsed and an integer denominator is parsed.The denominator cannot have a unary + or - preceding the digits.Parsing stops after the last digit in the denominator.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsDoubleNumber
member.summary: - The double number settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parse a number that can be integer, decimal, or scientific e notation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsRealNumber
member.summary: - The real number settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parse a number that can be integer, decimal, scientific e notation or pi.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsEmpty
member.summary: - ON_ParseSetting::FalseSettings has all parsing options set to false. - A common use of ON_ParseSettings FalseSettings is to initialize ON_ParseSettings classes that are used to report what happened during parsing.Any parsing results value set to true after parsing indicates that type of parsing occurred.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.PrimativeTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.PrimitiveTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.NormalTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.Evaluate(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Evaluate the mapping to get a texture coordinate
member.param: If the mapping projection is ray_projection, then this is the vertex unit normal. Otherwise n is ignored.
member.returns: Nonzero if evaluation is successful. When the mapping is a box or capped cylinder mapping, the value indicates which side was evaluated. Cylinder mapping: 1 = cylinder wall, 2 = bottom cap, 3 = top cap Box mapping: 1 = front, 2 = right, 3 = back, 4 = left, 5 = bottom, 6 = top

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.Evaluate(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Transform,Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Evaluate the mapping to get a texture coordinate
member.param: If the mapping projection is ray_projection, then this is the vertex unit normal. Otherwise n is ignored.
Transformation to be applied to P before performing the mapping calculation.
Transformation to be applied to N before performing the mapping calculation. One way to calculate nXxform is to use the call pXform::GetVectorTransform(nXform).
member.returns: Nonzero if evaluation is successful. When the mapping is a box or capped cylinder mapping, the value indicates which side was evaluated. Cylinder mapping: 1 = cylinder wall, 2 = bottom cap, 3 = top cap Box mapping: 1 = front, 2 = right, 3 = back, 4 = left, 5 = bottom, 6 = top

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Get a box projection from the texture mapping.
member.param: The center of the box is at plane.origin and the sides of the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes.

The "front" and "back" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.yaxis and plane.zaxis. The back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and the front plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0).

The "left" and "right" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.zaxis and plane.xaxis. The left plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dx[0],0) and the back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0).

The "top" and "bottom" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.xaxis and plane.yaxis. The bottom plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and the top plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]).
member.returns: Returns true if a valid box is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingBox will not return the same parameters passed to SetBoxMapping. However, the location of the box will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Get a box projection from the texture mapping, including capped information
member.param: The center of the box is at plane.origin and the sides of the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes.

The "front" and "back" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.yaxis and plane.zaxis. The back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and the front plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0).

The "left" and "right" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.zaxis and plane.xaxis. The left plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dx[0],0) and the back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0).

The "top" and "bottom" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.xaxis and plane.yaxis. The bottom plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and the top plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]).
true if box mapping is capped.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid box is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingBox will not return the same parameters passed to SetBoxMapping. However, the location of the box will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere@)
member.summary: Get a spherical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid sphere is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingShere will not return the same parameters passed to SetSphereMapping. However, the location of the sphere will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder@)
member.summary: Get a cylindrical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid cylinder is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingCylinder will not return the same parameters passed to SetCylinderMapping. However, the location of the cylinder will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Get a cylindrical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid cylinder is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingCylinder will not return the same parameters passed to SetCylinderMapping. However, the location of the cylinder will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

Portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1]

member.summary: Create a planar UV projection texture mapping

portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreatePlaneMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a planar projection texture mapping
member.param: A plane to use for mapping.
portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
set to true if planar UVW is meant, false for planar UV
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateOcsMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Create a Ocs texture mapping. Note that OCS mappings must be placed on mapping channel ON_ObjectRenderingAttributes::OCSMappingChannelId() otherwise they will not work.
member.param: A plane to use for mapping.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateCylinderMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a cylindrical projection texture mapping.
member.param: cylinder in world space used to define a cylindrical coordinate system. The angular parameter maps (0,2pi) to texture "u" (0,1), The height parameter maps (height[0],height[1]) to texture "v" (0,1), and the radial parameter maps (0,r) to texture "w" (0,1).
If true, the cylinder is treated as a finite capped cylinder
member.remarks: When the cylinder is capped and m_texture_space = divided, the cylinder is mapped to texture space as follows: The side is mapped to 0 <= "u" <= 2/3. The bottom is mapped to 2/3 <= "u" <= 5/6. The top is mapped to 5/6 <= "u" <= 5/6. This is the same convention box mapping uses.
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateSphereMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere)
member.summary: Create a spherical projection texture mapping.
member.param: sphere in world space used to define a spherical coordinate system. The longitude parameter maps (0,2pi) to texture "u" (0,1). The latitude parameter maps (-pi/2,+pi/2) to texture "v" (0,1). The radial parameter maps (0,r) to texture "w" (0,1).
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateBoxMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a box projection texture mapping.
member.param: The sides of the box the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes. The dx, dy, dz intervals determine the location of the sides.

Determines the location of the front and back planes. The vector plane.xaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0), respectively.

Determines the location of the left and right planes. The vector plane.yaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(0,dy[0],0) and plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0), respectively.

Determines the location of the top and bottom planes. The vector plane.zaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]), respectively.
If true, the box is treated as a finite capped box.
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateCustomMeshMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh)
member.summary: Create custom mesh mapping
member.returns: TextureMapping instance

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.CRC
member.summary: The decal CRC identifies a decal by its state. Multiple decals which would be exactly the same would have the same CRC and are culled from the system. If you store this value with the intention of using it to find the decal again later, you must update your stored value whenever the decal state changes. You can detect when a decal changes by watching for the OnUserDataTransformed event.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.North
member.summary: Angle in degrees on world X-Y plane that should be considered north in the model. The angle is measured starting at the x-axis and increases anti-clockwise. The y-axis corresponds to a 'north' angle of 90 degrees.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.Intensity
member.summary: Sun intensity.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.Light
member.summary: Get a Light which represents the sun. If manual control is in effect, no sun calculation is performed; the function uses the last known values of azimuth and altitude. If manual control is not in effect, the observer's position, date, time, time zone and daylight saving values are used to calculate the position of the sun.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.Azimuth
member.summary: The sun's azimuth in degrees. The value increases Eastwards with North as zero. Setting this value will also set the sun to manual control mode. Note: This value is not affected by the direction of north.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.Altitude
member.summary: The sun's altitude above the horizon in degrees in the range -90 to +90. Setting this value will also set the sun to manual control mode.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.Latitude
member.summary: The observer's latitude.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Sun.Longitude
member.summary: The observer's longitude.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Sun.GetDateTime(System.DateTimeKind)
member.summary:
Get the observer's date and time as a DateTime with kind DateTimeKind.Local.
Param 'kind' specifies the kind of date and time to retrieve from the sun.
- If DateTimeKind.Local, the returned DateTime will contain the local sun time, i.e., the time you see in the UI under 'Local'.
- If DateTimeKind.Utc, the returned DateTime will contain the UTC sun time, i.e., the time you see in the UI under 'UTC', which is the Sun's local time adjusted for its time zone and daylight saving (if any).
**** Local sun time is to do with the Sun's time zone and not the time zone of the computer.
**** The returned DateTime object always has a kind of Local even if you requested the sun's UTC date and time. This is because the Sun's time zone is nothing to do with the actual computer's time zone and converting the result would cause further confusion.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Sun.SetDateTime(System.DateTime,System.DateTimeKind)
member.summary:
Set the observer's date and time. kind specifies the kind of date and time to set to the sun. Note that this is distinct from the DateTimeKind of 'time' which has nothing to do with the sun's local/UTC scenario.
- If 'kind' is DateTimeKind.Local, the sun's local time will be set, i.e., the time you see in the UI under 'Local'. This is the preferred way to use this function.
- If 'kind' is DateTimeKind.Utc, the sun's UTC time will be set, i.e., the time you see in the UI under 'UTC'. This is only for completeness; it's not likely to be useful, but if you do use it, be aware that the sun will convert this time to local using its currently set time zone and daylight saving information (not the locale's information).
Caveat: Local sun time is to do with the Sun's time zone and not the time zone of the computer.
Caveat: If the supplied DateTime object has a kind of Local, it will be used verbatim. If, however, it has a kind of Utc, it will be converted to local time on the computer using the computer's time zone and daylight saving locale information before being passed to the sun. To avoid confusion, it's best to always use DateTimes with Kind 'Local' when setting the sun's date and time. This is because the Sun's time zone is nothing to do with the actual computer's time zone.
