member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorLCH
member.summary: Represents an LCH (Lightness, A, B) color with double precision floating point channels. LCH colors (also sometimes called CIELUV) are transformation of the 1931 CIE XYZ color space, in order to approach perceptual uniformity. They are primarily used in computer graphics which deal with colored lights.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorHSV
member.summary: Represents an HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) color with double precision floating point channels. HSV colors (also sometimes called HSB, where B means Brightness) are similar to HSL colors in that they represent colors in a cylindrical color space, and are intended to provide intuitive means to edit the brightness of a particular color over RGB color space where each color channel would need to be modified to affect the color brightness.

summary.para: Represents a dictionary class that can be attached to objects and can be serialized (saved) at necessity.

remarks.para: This is the layout of this object:

member.name: F:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.m_change_serial_number
member.summary: Counter that gets updated each time a new item is set or an existing one is updated. Used to track changes to the ArchivableDictionary.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of this .

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name string of this .

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.ChangeSerialNumber
member.summary: Retrieve current change serial number. This is a number that gets increased each time a datum is set or changed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of a dictionary for writing to a 3dm archive.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of a dictionary for writing to a 3dm archive
member.param: parent user data if this dictionary is associated with user data

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of a dictionary for writing to a 3dm archive.
member.param: Custom version used to help the plug-in developer determine which version of a dictionary is being written. One good way to write version information is to use a date style integer (YYYYMMDD)

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of a dictionary for writing to a 3dm archive.
member.param: custom version used to help the plug-in developer determine which version of a dictionary is being written. One good way to write version information is to use a date style integer (YYYYMMDD)
Optional name to associate with this dictionary. NOTE: if this dictionary is set as a sub-dictionary, the name will be changed to the sub-dictionary key entry

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Protected constructor for internal use.

member.summary: Populates a System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo with the data needed to serialize the target object.

member.summary: Recursively sets the parent user data for this dictionary

member.summary: Reads a dictionary from an archive.
member.param: The archive to read from. The archive position should be at the beginning of the dictionary
member.returns: new filled dictionary on success. null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.Write(Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter)
member.summary: Writes this dictionary to an archive.
member.returns: true on success.

member.summary: Gets all entry names or keys.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.Values
member.summary: Gets all values in this dictionary.

member.summary: Determines whether the dictionary contains the specified key.
member.returns: true if the dictionary contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.
member.exception: key is null.

member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get or set.
member.returns: The value associated with the specified key. If the specified key is not found, a get operation throws a .
member.exception: If the key is null.
If the key is not found.

member.summary: Removes all keys and values from the dictionary.

member.name: T:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1
member.summary: Represents a list of generic data. This class is similar to System.Collections.Generic.List(T) but exposes a few more methods.

member.name: F:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.m_items
member.summary: Internal array of items. The array will contain trailing invalid items if Capacity > Count. WARNING! Do not store a reference to this array anywhere! The List class may decide to replace the internal array with another one.

member.name: F:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.m_size
member.summary: The number of "valid" elements in m_items (same as m_count in ON_SimpleArray)

member.name: F:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.m_version
member.summary: The version counter is incremented whenever a change is made to the list.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new, empty list.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an empty list with a certain capacity.
member.param: Number of items this list can store without resizing.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.#ctor(System.Int32,`0)
member.summary: Initializes a new list with a specified amount of values.
member.param: Number of values to add to this list. Must be equal to or larger than zero.
Value to add, for reference types, the same item will be added over and over again.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Initializes this list as a shallow duplicate of another list, array or any other enumerable set of T.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.#ctor(Rhino.Collections.RhinoList{`0})
member.summary: Initializes an new list by shallow duplicating another list.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.ToArray
member.summary: Constructs an array that contains all items in this list.
member.returns: An array containing all items in this list.

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.TrimExcess
member.summary: Sets the capacity to the actual number of elements in the List, if that number is less than a threshold value.
member.remarks: This function differs from the DotNET implementation of List<T> since that one only trims the excess if the excess exceeds 10% of the list length.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of elements the internal data structure can hold without resizing.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements actually contained in the List.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.NullCount
member.summary: Gets the number of null references (Nothing in Visual Basic) in this list. If T is a ValueType, this property always return zero.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
member.returns: The element at the specified index.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.System#Collections#IList#Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
member.returns: The element at the specified index.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.First
member.summary: Gets or sets the first item in the list. This is synonymous to calling List[0].

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.Last
member.summary: Gets or sets the last item in the list. This is synonymous to calling List[Count-1].

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.RemapIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remap an index in the infinite range onto the List index range.
member.returns: Remapped index.

member.name: P:Rhino.Collections.RhinoList`1.System#Collections#IList#IsReadOnly
member.summary: When implemented by a class, gets a value indicating whether the IList is read-only. RhinoList is never ReadOnly.

member.name: T:Rhino.RhinoMath
member.summary: Provides constants and static methods that are additional to .

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.HalfPI
member.summary: Quarter of a rotation. 90 degrees. 1.57...

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.QuarterPI
member.summary: One eigth of a rotation. 45 degrees. 0.78...

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.TwoPI
member.summary: Full rotation. 360 degrees. 6.28...

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.Tau
member.summary: Ratio of circumference divided by radius. Full rotation. 360 degrees. 6.28...

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.ZeroTolerance
member.summary: Gets Rhino's Zero Tolerance constant, which is 2^-32. In cases when an absolute "zero" tolerance is required to compare model space coordinates, ZeroTolerance is used. The value of ZeroTolerance should be no smaller than and should be several orders of magnitude smaller than .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_ZERO_TOLERANCE.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetValue
member.summary: Gets the Rhino standard Unset value. Use this value rather than Double.NaN when a bogus floating point value is required.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_UNSET_VALUE.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.Epsilon
member.summary: Gets the value of DBL_EPSILON, which is the smallest positive floating point number x such that 1 + x != 1. This is different than Double.Epsilon which is the smallest positive Double value that is greater than zero.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_EPSILON.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.SqrtEpsilon
member.summary:
Represents a default value that is used when comparing square roots.
This value is several orders of magnitude larger than .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_SQRT_EPSILON.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.DefaultAngleTolerance
member.summary:
Represents the default angle tolerance, used when no other values are provided.
This is one degree, expressed in radians.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_DEFAULT_ANGLE_TOLERANCE.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.DefaultDistanceToleranceMillimeters
member.summary: Get Rhino's default distance tolerance in millimeters.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_DEFAULT_DISTANCE_TOLERANCE_MM.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetSingle
member.summary: Gets the single precision floating point number that is considered 'unset' in Rhino.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_UNSET_FLOAT.

member.name: F:Rhino.RhinoMath.UnsetIntIndex
member.summary: When signed int values are used in a context where 0 and small negative values are valid indices and there needs to be a value that indicates the index is not set.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to openNURBS ON_UNSET_INT_INDEX.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoMath.ToRadians(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert an angle from degrees to radians.
member.param: Degrees to convert (180 degrees equals pi radians).

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoMath.ToDegrees(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert an angle from radians to degrees.
member.param: Radians to convert (180 degrees equals pi radians).

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoMath.IsValidDouble(System.Double)
member.summary:
Determines whether a value is valid within the RhinoCommon context.
Rhino does not use Double.NaN by convention, so this test evaluates to true if:
x is not equal to RhinoMath.UnsetValue
System.Double.IsNaN(x) evaluates to false
System.Double.IsInfinity(x) evaluates to false
member.returns: true if the number if valid, false if the number is NaN, Infinity or Unset.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoMath.IsValidSingle(System.Single)
member.summary:
Determines whether a value is valid within the RhinoCommon context.
Rhino does not use Single.NaN by convention, so this test evaluates to true if:
x is not equal to RhinoMath.UnsetValue,
System.Single.IsNaN(x) evaluates to false
System.Single.IsInfinity(x) evaluates to false
member.returns: true if the number if valid, false if the number is NaN, Infinity or Unset.

member.returns: The text representation of the int index.

member.name: T:Rhino.UI.LOC
member.summary: Used a placeholder which is used by LocalizationProcessor application to create contextId mapped localized strings.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.STR(System.String)
member.summary: Strings that need to be localized should call this function. The STR function doesn't actually do anything but return the original string. The LocalizationProcessor application walks through the source code of a project and looks for LOC.STR. The function is then replaced with a call to Localization.LocalizeString using a unique context ID.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.STR(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Similar to function.
member.returns: English name.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.STR(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: DO NOT use this function, it is a trap to determine where context IDs have been copied from other, already extracted, strings.
member.returns: English name.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.COMMANDNAME(System.String)
member.summary: Command names that need to be localized should call this function. The COMMANDNAME function doesn't actually do anything but return the original string. The LocalizationProcessor application walks through the source code of a project and looks for LOC.COMMANDNAME and builds a record for each command name for the translators that can be used by developers in a commands overridden Rhino.Commands.Command.LocalName which should call Rhino.UI.Localization.LocalizeCommandName(EnglishName)

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.CON(System.String)
member.summary: Command option name strings that need to be localized should call this function. The CON function doesn't actually do anything but return the original string. The LocalizationProcessor application walks through the source code of a project and looks for LOC.CON. The function is then replaced with a call to Localization.LocalizeCommandOptionName using a unique context ID.
member.returns: Returns localized string pair with both the English and local names set to the English value.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.CON(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Command option name strings that need to be localized should call this function. The CON function doesn't actually do anything but return the original string. The LocalizationProcessor application walks through the source code of a project and looks for LOC.CON. The function is then replaced with a call to Localization.LocalizeCommandOptionName using a unique context ID.
member.param: [in] The object that identifies the assembly that owns the command option name.
member.returns: Returns localized string pair with both the English and local names set to the English value.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.CON(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: DO NOT use this function, it is a trap to determine where context IDs have been copied from other, already extracted, strings.
member.returns: English name.
